reviewText:
Early Access Review

As it is right now, this is a fun game despite how light on content it currently is, and I'm looking forward to what is planned for future updates.

- Combat is pretty simple: you have a melee and ranged attack, you can dodge and you have three special attacks. Simple enough to learn, even a team of novice players could take on a few dozen Grimm with no problems once they learn the attack patterns of each monster. Luckily the next update is set to add a bit more depth to the combat with heavy and counter attacks, as well as balancing the Grimm accordingly, which is great as I feel like it's a bit too easy right now.

- The campaign we have right now adds up to maybe around an hour of gameplay. I hope the other planned campaigns and horde mode will be enough to keep people engaged. That said, the MOBA-like micro-progression is already a good reason for people to keep playing. You can't unlock every skill, but its fun to play around with different skill setups and see how effective they are. I love the combination of micro-progression and the fast paced action of a co-op hack-n-slash, I think it works great

- The game looks great, which isn't much of a surprise since they're basically using the exact character and weapon models, as well as art style, as the show

- Overall performance is great, pretty much constant 60fps, until you start fighting more Grimm at a time. Playing solo, this isn't much of an issue since the difficulty scales and you'll be fighting maybe at most 15 or less enemies at any one time. But with a full or almost full lobby, the number of enemies definitely starts to hit your performance a bit, and I have a decent rig (though I'm sure someone with a more powerful PC than mine would handle this just fine). It's most noticeable when you're in the collapsed Mountain Glenn sublevels fighting a large amount of enemies, with some that explode upon death

Great to see RWBY expanding to other media forms outside of the show, and great job to the dev team creating basically the exact game I imagined should be made after seeing each of the show trailers way back in 2013, I'm almost certain Monty would have loved to see this game to completion

reviewText:
Early Access Review

after thirty minutes of playing the game and finding a few awesome people to play it with ( Lots of RT fans!) I think I can safely write a review about this game.

Now, being 100% completely honest, the only downside to this game is the fact it is multiplayer only and yes, you can create a lobby and set it to friends only to play by yourself, but  it is still online, which means if you want to play the game offline, you are out of luck!

The gameplay is pretty solid in terms of what they promised, it's hack n' slash with no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t involved, just plain ol' hack n' slash.


Now comes the bad things!  There is an audio issue that really doesn't give you an in between, it's either too loud or too quiet, so you either start losing your hearing because it is so loud or you end up missing half of the things said because it is too quiet!

The graphical presets are pretty weak , even though I got a chuckle out of the 'potato' setting, but switching the settings literally did nothing and did make the game run better or worse, so it made me question why they included them.

the skill tree system is simple , which is fine, but it is too easy to get all of the skills in one game which brings me to another thing!

a progression system, while there is one in mid game, I think they could do ranks or a progression system outside of that, instead of having to get everything and earn it all again, which gets pretty tiring after awhile.

For an early access game, it's not too bad and it needs work for sure, but I hope RT reads the feedback and does this game some justice!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I picked this game up on a whim, largely because a lot of my friends like the series.  Though this game is in early access, RTG  has done a fantastic job of making the game run smoothly on systems old and new.  Samapuma and I both played through all three parts of the first chapter on one of my old and one of my lower spec'ed laptops without the game overheating or lagging significantly and we had a blast playing it.  So, now to the meat of the review.

This game is very much a toast to fans.  Those who are familiar with the series will appreciate that most of the original voice cast were used and the character models are really well done across all resolutions.  Considering the series was made entirely in CG, it would be disappointing if that wasn't the case.  The character animations are smooth, and ultra settings look great, even on my old laptop, which is only sporting an HD3650 video card and a gb of video ram.

The music is subtle and has enough length and variation that you don't get tired of listening to it as you play through the game.  I would probably pick up the soundtrack if it was made available later on.  The backgrounds match what little I saw of the tv series.  Actually, I'd say they are a bit better.  The series had very simple backgrounds with not a lot of details, but the backgrounds and scenery used in the game are pretty well detailed and don't seem like they just spammed a single model everywhere to put things together.  Some sort of notation about the edge of the map and ledges you can and cannot fall off of would be nice, though.

The map layouts, despite the above notation, are pretty good and make good use of corners for hiding things without making it ridiculously hard on for more casual players, and use different levels and heights for various things rather well.  The only stage where I had a problem with the map was probably the third part where you are doing a very tedious task while fighting enemies.  I don't have a problem with the task specifically; it was a nice change of pace, but, since the radar does not have a minimap or indicator for quest objectives, the mission was a bit harder than it needed to be.

The gameplay is smooth on a controller and less-so without.  I'd not recommend playing this game without a 360 or XBOne gamepad.  Armed with a gamepad, the controls are pretty well done and fairly intuitive.  Once you get used to holding down the trigger in order to execute your specials, you'll most likely be in good shape.  There were no signs of input lag between when the button is pushed and the character indicates the move, and charging times for specials are reasonable.

The difficulty for this game is a bit all over the place, however.  Samapuma is a casual gamer and not particularly good at these sorts of games.  Once she got used to it, she was helpful, but still had difficulty with most of the enemies, and that's not a good thing.  The game scales pretty smoothly for having more players, but is becomes very button mashy and less experienced players may have trouble keeping track of what does what.  The characters seem to have a good bit of variation to their moveset, while keeping to every character having a melee and ranged attack.

In conclusion, this is a very good game, especially for an early release title, and I look forward to seeing what they add to the game as it grows and develops.  Things I'd like to see added to the game would be, perhaps, a character customization feature where you can make your own student at the academy, with either generic voice or none at all.  I'd be happy to just play my own character in this setting.  I'd really like for there to be some degree of difficulty setting.  Samapuma couldn't really fully enjoy the game because she was struggling against a lot of the monsters, especially the rolling ones and the bears later in the game.  A single player campaign with either AI allies or even just taking one of the characters out solo would be nice.  This would give players a chance to practice various characters without having to deal with more experienced players complaining about how they don't know how to play for multiplayer.  Keep it short and I'm sure people will still be encouraged to play the game online with others.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I try to make it as short as possible, (viewpoint of a fan)

Hi !
I was really excited to see this game. i instantly bought it and i really enjoyed it. Me as a fan of the series was really happy to see/hear thinks like the original voice actors, graphics styles, humor's and Personallity's of the Characters.

Now to the Gameplay:
First of - i know its early access -
second - hack-n-slash games are not my favorite type of game genres -

so,
the Gameplay is really fast paced
Fighting feels fluid (very important!)
Skills are nice and feeling great and fits most of the Characters( the only one not fitting is Blake's Blade blast, but im not 100% sure if i ever saw her doing that)
Enemies are really cool and they differ from each other with differnt visuals and attacks
the amount of enemies is also a really importent thing for me, the amount changes the more player are with you ( later more to this) with 4 four player its A LOT could be more but its definitely enough to have fun
Levels are tubes with fixed points where enemies spawn and things to defend ( in waves (really cool))

In short , nice fundamentals, can only get better

There is only one big thing that is not well done, the Character uniqueness, except the skills every char feels the same except Blake, she is arial styled and maybe yang because her attacks are a little bit slower. For now all you do is bashing left click to generate special points" to use skills and dodging with shift. ( i know heavy attacks and counters are in development)

a small other thing i dont like :
Animation "weirdness". I am a sucker for good animations hence i dont like the run animations for ruby and blake( they both run like this in the series
recommended:
but non combat running looks different especially Ruby's) and the sprints look like the normal already weird run animation. Combat animations are already really nice

Thats about the things already in the game now i want to talk about what i want to see in future updates.

Horde Mode
They announced it already but still i want to add a few things i want to see in this particular game mode

1. and most importent i want to fight A LOT of enemies. In this case i want quantity not quality a bad example is the zombie mode in Call of Duty - the enemies get stronger not larger in count - means it gets boring much more faster. A good example is Dead Rising (especially  3) - thousands of enemies all die in 1-2 hits - lot of fun.

Throw Hundreds of enemies at me bring in 2-5 maps and et voilà a good horde mode.

Difficulty
in-game difficulty is measured in player count in your party
hoursPlayed: means more players = more enemies . I really dont like this. i love to play solo means i get forced to play coop when i want more enemies. I REALLY hope they change this especially in horde mode. ( like in Diablo 3
voteText:
same amount of enemies but with more health)

Skills
Just more selectable skills for each char (easier said then done
helpfulPercent: i know( i want to play ruby
votesHelpful:
slam her scythe in the ground und start spamming shots like a mad man)

Aim
I like to aim my shots

Attack Combos
you know
votesTotal: twice left click then e
votesFunny: space
commentsCount: q
column16: e
column17: e left click
column18: right click
column19: 1 then 3 than space again\njust kidding you know what kind of combos
column20:
maybe possible with the new Heavy attacks ?

Visualls
more precisely Chararacter outfit preferred the ones from the show.(*cough* Blake's Intruder outfit)

No microtransactions
i have nothing against good filled Dlc's tho


Last but not least few notes to the dev team(i hope they read this)

First Thanks!
Secondly great job

that is all


Tl;dr:

I recommend it because:
Nice fundementals
Needs:
more content and unique fighting styles between the Characters

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are a fan of RWBY and wont to support the game then by all means buy it, otherwise I would not recommend it in it's current sate. This game is a common hack and slash that must be played with friends as single player play is currently unblanced, boring, and just plain unfun.
The combat is not very fuild and combos will very often stop due to buggy counter attacks or teamattacks. Although, why do any of those things when holding down the power attack button and spaming it over and over can get you thorugh the game just fine.
The enemys themselfs are not hard unless they are in large numbers muli hitting you in what essenaly boils down to a one shot KO. While only slightly annoying in muliplayer, this is a huge problem in single player. You see, in muliplayer teamates can come over and revive you, and fairly quickly with a certan perk so being knocked out is not a big deal, however in single player you lose and must restart from a previous checkpoint. This is very tidous if you are engaged in a muliwave combat  you will not restart from the wave you died on, but all the way back to wave one. This gets very annoying and made me want to stop experminitng with combos, dodges, and counter attacks, to just going back to the power attack spam for fear of restarting all the waves agian.
Overall RWBY is a work in progress game that should only be played with friends.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It really breaks my heart to say this, but in the game's current state I cannot, or rather, can no longer recommend it.

The game has always been about killing waves upon waves of the same Grimm with the same attacks over and over, but that didn't really hurt the game much because the combat just felt so good. There aren't a lot of combos but the characters all play radically differently and, between the animation and sound effects borrowed from the show, felt like they hit hard.

However, since the Forever Fall update the characters now look like creepy lifeless dolls and the sound effects borrowed from the show were replaced by generic noises. Feeling like the show may not seem like much but it was this game's main selling point, and the dev team seems to have put an astonishing amount of time and effort into moving away from that.

I'll change this review immediately if it moves back in the right direction. Consider the dislike mere protest.

EDIT: They've made it pretty clear that the old models were always meant to be placeholders so...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I personally am a huge RWBY fan. Which is why I want this game to be great and it is to some extent. However there are some major flaws. Im going to be as constructive as I can with my criticism. PLEASE ANYONE FROM THE GRIMM ECLIPSE TEAM THAT IS READING THIS I IMPLORE YOU TO READ IT ALL THE WAY THROUGH AND TAKE IT INTO CONSIDERATION. Anyone who has read the recent reviews see the backlash they are recieving from their recent updates. It seems at the start everyone loved it but now some people still really enjoy it while others have completely flipped their opinion. I like to say I'm somewhere in the middle. So starting with the things they need to improve or rather reimprove. (There is nothing I can say that hasn't been said a million times but it needs to be said a million more untill they fix it.
* The face models- This is probably the biggest thing. I don't want to say that it ruins the game but its pretty bad.

* The overall detail of the characters- This goes hand in hand with the face models. I CAN'T STRESS ENOUGH THE IMPORTANCE OF GETTING THE CHARACTERS TO LOOK AS MUCH LIKE THE SHOW AS POSSIBLE.  If your take one thing from this review take what I just said (caps).

*Grimm are damage sponges- DId grimm recieve aura all of sudden? Its so important in Hack n Slash games to not have damage sponges unless they are mini bosses or actual bosses. If you want to make it more difiicult simply add more grimm.

*Improve the ability trees- The ability trees are far too barebones and some abilites aren't even worth getting. The more unique and diverse abilities you can add the more playstyles there will be.

Now for the things you can add to the game.

* Character interaction (IMPORTANT)- This is will definitely add to the story and replay value. Make the members of RWBY react to one another. For example, Yang makes a pun all members should have a reaction but they shouldn't all use it at once. For example in my example, Yang says her pun Weiss and Blake react to it and then Yang could even counter react to their receptions of the pun. However the next time you go through this level. Yang makes the same pun and only Ruby reacts to it. The next time you go through it nobody reacts to it since you're running a full team of Yangs. You see, it makes each playthrough unique. The longer the team can hold conversations with each other the more immersed you'll get into to it and the less it will feel like the same predetermined remarks. Sorry this one was so long its just really important.

* Bosses- I think it would be really cool to see Torchwich, Cinder, etc cameo as bosses or if you want to make some new villians for the game that would be cool too. I just dont want to fight a giant mindless grimm for every boss.

*Different enemy factions- I know its called grimm eclipse but maybe you could add in the white fang or again make a new faction of enemies that could call alongside the new villians.

*Misc- As much as I love fighting it would be cool to see Beacon as level even if its just for a bit. For this Beacon level the fighting part could be team RWBY going up agiant team CRDl in a sparring match. THAT WOULD BE AWESOME. Also of course lets get some more playable character and/or cameos from some of the other teams.

Thats about it. It took me forever to write this which I hope shows you how much a care about this game. If you guys truly want to listen to the community and make the best RWBY game you can like you say you do than implement some, hopefully all of these changes. I think the RWBY communtiy can agree with me on most all of things I said. I know it must be hard making this game from the ground up. I hope this helps.

P.S. The only reason I choose to not recommend this game is because I thought those are the reviews you would look at the most.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

FULL DISCLAIMER: I have been a huge fan of Rooster Teeth since the company was founded. That being said, I'm happy to give constructive criticism as I think it's very important, especially for a Steam Early Access title.

The Rundown
RWBY: Grimm Eclipse (will refer to it as GE" from now on) is a hack n' slash style co-op game
date: where you play as a team with up to 3 friends to defeat the Grimm and figure out what's going on in the world of Remnant. Using the level up system to become stronger
recommended:
defeat waves of Grimm and complete objectives until you finally reach your goal.

Presentation
Simply put
hoursPlayed: GE looks pretty awesome. It's very colorful
voteText: and the landscape suits the game. Fans of the anime will find that the art style is extremely similar to the show
helpfulPercent: and it works very well for it. The soundtrack is also well done
votesHelpful: and fits the style of GE perfectly. The UI is great
votesTotal: as doesn't get in the way while simultaneously being helpful and not over-cluttered. Users playing on a lower resolution might find things hard to read as the text is also downscaled harshly with the game itself
votesFunny: which might be my only complaint about the game. You also cannot edit the video settings on your own
commentsCount: and are limited to only 3 options; potato
column16: standard
column17:
and ultra.

Gameplay
GE has a very simple "button smashing" type combat system. You press one button for your basic attack
column18: one button for your ranged attack
column19: and there's also 3 special attacks that all have unique qualities depending on which of the 4 characters you're playing as. To earn special attacks
column20: you must achieve combos (which aren't too hard) that will grant you a special attack point. The game also uses a pretty cool leveling system where you earn XP to level up
column21: and each time you level up

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll start by saying two things. Firstly, I don't usually play hack-and-slash games OR co-op games, and if I wasn't a RWBY fan  then I probably wouldn't have glanced twice at this game. Secondly, it launched on Early Access literally yesterday, so there's a lot of updates and improvements to come. I'll edit this review over time to reflect those. With that out of the way...

Pros:
*Fun, exciting gameplay
*Varied objectives (the bomb cart sequence, for example)
*Good graphics
*Very faithful to the original series - if you like RWBY then you'll like this game
*Challenging without being frustrating (for the most part)
*Great music and sound effects

Cons:
*No tutorial, not even a controls screen. The HUD tells you how to use Specials and spend your Ability Points, and that's it. (WASD to move, Space to jump, Left-Click for melee attacks, Right-Click for ranged attacks, press T to talk. You're welcome.)
*Current EXP system effectively encourages kill-stealing
*Poorly optimized. My laptop isn't the fastest but I'm not the only one with poor frame rates
*Some of the dialogue is almost inaudible even at max volume [EDIT: This has now been fixed]
*Dunno if it's just me but some of the upgrades don't seem to make much of a difference
*Your basic ranged attacks (especially Ruby's) are pretty much useless as they're slow and do almost no damage

In spite of all its problems, however, I really did enjoy playing this, and I'm confident that the problems listed above will be ironed out in time. I'd honestly recommend this game, but if you're put off by its issues, come back in a few months' time and I'm sure it'll have improved a lot by then.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Welcome to the Robot Maid Review of... RWBY: Grimm Eclipse.

Disclaimer: Even though it says recommended"
hoursPlayed: VERY tentative recommendation.\n\nThe game as it stands is severely lacking in content which isn't a problem for an early access game
voteText: but because there is a price tag
helpfulPercent:
they open themselves up to formal criticisms.

Settings wise is very bare bones. A few presets and audio sliders. The lack of mapping controls or changing any settings is a minor problem which would likely be fixed later in the game.

Aesthetically
votesHelpful: the game is pleasing and keeps to the art and animation style of the source web-series. While this is great for combat and environments
votesTotal: a few minor animations look strange and unnatural. Hopefully this is changed in the future.\n\nMechanically
votesFunny: the game handles very well in combat with a few strange mechanics which are questionable in quality in my opinion. The game takes inspiration from any game that gives you a red warning sign whenever the enemy attacks

column18: the MOBA style leveling system DOES NOT WORK. It doesn't promote teamwork because only the player getting the kill gets EXP so if you want to get to higher levels

column20: it's a very flawed system. In my opinion
column21: it should be something similar to Castle Crashers
column22: where levels are tied to the characters (levels gained on Yang would not carry over to playing Ruby
column23:
etc).

My final thoughts on the game is that it isn't bad. It's got solid gameplay with a few strange happenings and a few bugs or oversights. I personally wouldn't recommend it at this price unless you have a friend or three willing to join you in playing as a bunch of girls with weapons combined with guns. Or Weiss.

This has been a Robot Maid Review. Thank you for reading."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love, love, LOVE this game! I'm so addicted! I only got it 2 days ago, but I've played through it like 8 times now!! It's a LOT of fun, and the replay value is DEFINITELY there! Even though you're facing the same enemies, it never feels boring or repetitive to go through and tackle them again, finding new areas and unlocking new abilities along the way!

I've been reading through the comments and reviews, however, and I feel there are a couple of criticisms out there that aren't completely valid. At least for the sake of the developers potentially reading through this, I wanted to correct some of them and point out that we don't all feel that way; and maybe revision in those areas isn't actually necessary.

My biggest beef is people complaining that the bosses aren't hard enough". I think the reason this bothers me so much is because I LOVE the flow of the game--I think it's been perfectly executed! It's always clear when one area moves onto the next
date: when some enemies are harder to kill than others
recommended: requiring more of your character's skill and special abilities. It feels like a story that way--it feels like RWBY!! Any fan of the show will truly appreciate the immersiveness of it all. But I think people complaining about the boss difficulty are wanting it to be a different game than what it is.... as a hack and slash game
hoursPlayed: and especially as a RWBY game
voteText: I think it's valuable that the characters feel strong... that the pace is constantly moving forward
helpfulPercent: and the fight scenes are immersive! I would be really sad if the developers felt the need to change this

votesTotal:
and then some of that atmosphere was lost...

Some constructive feedback that I do agree with however are:
--the XP sharing thing; there is currently no real XP sharing. I don't have so much of an issue with the potential kill stealing

Early Access Review

If you are a fan of the show this is basically a must have.

At the moment it is still in development and there is not a ton to play but what there is, is fun.

The characters all feel relatively close to what we see in the show (or at least as close as one can get with a game based on an anime) and different enough from each other that you will wind up finding one you like the most. The only downside i see to the characters as they don't exactly feel like they have any of there Semblance from the show really (they have little things for some but mostly just visual).

The graphics are almost identical to the show when at max imo but the problem is that even though they look good with the small amount of mobs and the type of graphics i would expect the game to run much better on lower end machines then it does (but that is getting fixed with patches as they continue to make the game).

Over all this is a solid game that once finished (If it keeps up with the direction it is going and they add a good amount more content) this will be one of the best anime to game ports i have seen as far as keeping the look and feel.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Based on 3.9 hours of game play.

Yes this game is early access. It is however very enjoyable. This is only but a teaser of what is to come. The play style is new and VERY MOBA. You don't get to keep any levels between play throughs. Which is interesting. However you DO get to keep challenge rewards. Challenges are things you do to unlock later teir skills and abilities. The progress is saved and so is the skill/ability unlock. An interesting addition that makes you want to play the game over and over again. Even though I have notice a lot of bugs and some things missing that I would LOVE added I can honestly say I ENJOY playing this game! The fighting can be hard to understand at first but when it clicks you become a badass in an instant.

cons:

There is a lack of Music but I am sure it is comming! The series had a lot of epic music in battles so I am sure this will come into effect with in an update or two.

I feel jumping should be more epic than it is.

Some characters special passives don't seem to be in effect... Weiss' glyphs should give her a double jump at least (doesn't), Ruby has super speed but Blake seems to be faster then she is in game, and with Yang she should get stronger the less HP she has but I don't really see or feel that happening. These things however COULD be skills later in the skill trees that I have not seen/noticed. That would be wonderful.

Pros:

The voice acting shows promise and will only get better in time.

The environments are as beautiful as the show.

The fighting is satisfying and beautiful to watch. I hope they bring more combos into it though but as it is it feels really nice.

Characters randomly interact with each other vocally.

The game, like the show, revolves around team work to get through the levels. Making you feel like an ACTUAL team!

The abilities are just so much fun to watch.

As a fan, you get a sudden rush of glee everytime someone moves or does an ability like you notice in the show.


in conclusion there is a lot of things to fix but it is a strong start and I am sure the game is only going to get better! It is enjoyable short game to play right now but has TONS of replayablilty and is heading in a VERY nice direction.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hack 'N' Slash.... a genre I don't usually play. However being a fan of the actual animated series I decided to give the game a fair go.

The game is still not fully completed and as such I can't talk about the full story as it's journey has yet to be finished, however the cannon storyline is both interesting and in-depth. However this is contrasted heavily by the chaotic combat, supplied by the online main story mode.

The leveling system is very fair being that when you start any game, you are level one unless you joing a mid-game session in which to are boosted to the average level. Kill monsters, collect experience orbs and artifacts to gain experience. Upon leveling up you can spend one point per level, with the points stacking up. The tree flow design is simple yet effective with various challenges to unlock additional skills. All in all requiring you to play certain characters to unlock unique special abilities or any to unlock generic upgrades such as health or aura.

The only problem with this system is that players are more orientated on experience than team work. I was walking for a box, that could potentially house an experience orb, before a player jumped in front to take my box. This is similar to combat against enemies. I can understand if it's a clustered fight and there is too many for one person but if I'm versing a single monster and I start to go for the last strike to kill it and earn the experience I don't like how people can do a ranged attack, defeat it and earn your experience. A shared pool may be needed?

Realistic point... would I buy the game still knowing what I know? The simple answer, yes. The simplistic combat system is still both fun and engaging. It may be experience orientated but it is still humorous when playing with friends over skype. YES, play with friends. I enourage it to the ends of the earth. It allows better teamwork skills are is more enjoyable.

======================================================================
Comat Update Review

Recently I decided to play this game again because I'm bored from lack of work. To my suprise I found an extensive rework of the combat system. To me it had appeared as if the ranged button had been removed for a heavy attack (right click) and for the first ten minutes I taught myself all the new combos I need and their effects.

I was playing for about ten minutes before a teammate casually asked why I didn't use my barrage ability to which I regrett saying, because I sounded like a noob, how?". Apparently the 'R' now acts as your ranged attack with 'E' preforming a finishing move and 'F' making your charcter sprint to a enemy like they're offering free money.

The single player option is nice
date: allowing you to master your skills by yourself before worrying about multiplayer where people judge (as I was without knowing ranged abilities). The graphics and camera additions are implimented flawlessly with the game's appeal and overall its been a great update.\n\nWould I recommend the game
hoursPlayed: even more so than the previous time. The combat style makes it feel more worthwile and meaningful when an enemy actually dies. Improved enemy AI makes the game harder and more strategical rather than ridicously overpowered. Keep going developers. I'll be here and waiting."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a Rooster Teeth fan for 6 years now I have been incredibly biased on what they produce... Until now.
I played the fan game and the version they had for people to play at RTX and I don't see much improvement in this version of the game, the combat is super simple: spam left click, right click every once in a while, use your special moves when you are surrounded or you're attacking a tough enemy, and dash away when you're low on health. It would be fun to put on while you marathon a podcast, cartoon, etc in the background but it has incredibly frustrating aspects to the game like how teamwork is non existent and is actually more competitive in a bad way, the objective besides getting to the end of the level is to level up your character from last hitting an enemy, I repeat LAST HITTING an enemy so everyone attacking a powerful enemy to cooperatively kill it doesn't happen except when all other enemies are dead what normally happens is everyone separates and gets hordes of their own to kill and then try to get the final blow on the tough enemies that that poor sucker was attacking the whole time. There are no two person combos like in the show besides multiple people flaying their weapon at the enemies to hopefully get the last hit, also multiple people can play the same character when the lobby caps at 4 people so I kid not every 4 man lobby I've been in consisted of Ruby, Yang, Weiss, and Weiss. It just doesn't look or feel right. Other problems, all character progression go away once you leave a game which is fine but you can't leave and pick up where you last left off, the levels are all very repetitive, enter an area kill monster, enter another kill monsters, enter an area protect a stationary object from monsters, rinse and repeat, the enemy's are all so similar with slight differences in health and looks with one exception of the boar looking ones who role and have armor In certain spots so as far as I can tell no big bosses like the giant bird they fought in season one, I wouldn't know if there is because I can't make it 20 minutes without getting bored and quitting. You can't customize the resolution because wouldn't change to 1920x1080 it would just revert to 720 after trying to change it, the sound options are a joke, you have voice volume and music volume so I can't turn down anything else so I can't hear anything the characters are saying half the time because so much is going on. The game drops frame rate way to often on my computer that can run Battlefield 3 on full ultra graphics settings and Skyrim with all of the best graphics enhancements mods I could find. So overall the game is really boring and frustrating because of cooperative gameplay turning into competitive gameplay with a story that I don't know because i can't hear what they are saying and putting on subtitles and looking at the subtitles takes me away from the action, I have drop into a quick match in the middle of the game because their is no solo mode and none of my friends own the game. I realize the game is in early access but this is what is what Is wrong with its current state and I do realize that fan boys are going to down vote this because the game is 10/10 perfect no flaws in there eyes but I payed $15 wanting to like it and couldn't bring myself to play it for 20 full minutes.

EDIT: After playing for a little while more I felt like I should add somethings that I like about this game to my otherwise fully negative review, I figured out how to play solo, you have to start a new game which puts you in a lobby and you have to do nothing until everyone else in the lobby gets tired of waiting for you then leaves then put the lobby to friends only, it is really mean to do but I really wanted to play solo and playing through the game I found it to be more enjoyable than a lobby full of people because it brings an actual challenge to the game, also the voice acting is pretty good and the graphics are pretty impressive. The only negative things that weren't mentioned above were that the running animation is not good at all the characters often start floating going up and down stairs and such but this isn't a big problem at all. Another problem is that there are invisible borders everywhere which didn't bother me much. It still is ironic that a RWBY game is more enjoyable solo than Co-op

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a Rooster Teeth fan for 6 years now I have been incredibly biased on what they produce... Until now.
I played the fan game and the version they had for people to play at RTX and I don't see much improvement in this version of the game, the combat is super simple: spam left click, right click every once in a while, use your special moves when you are surrounded or you're attacking a tough enemy, and dash away when you're low on health. It would be fun to put on while you marathon a podcast, cartoon, etc in the background but it has incredibly frustrating aspects to the game like how teamwork is non existent and is actually more competitive in a bad way, the objective besides getting to the end of the level is to level up your character from last hitting an enemy, I repeat LAST HITTING an enemy so everyone attacking a powerful enemy to cooperatively kill it doesn't happen except when all other enemies are dead what normally happens is everyone separates and gets hordes of their own to kill and then try to get the final blow on the tough enemies that that poor sucker was attacking the whole time. There are no two person combos like in the show besides multiple people flaying their weapon at the enemies to hopefully get the last hit, also multiple people can play the same character when the lobby caps at 4 people so I kid not every 4 man lobby I've been in consisted of Ruby, Yang, Weiss, and Weiss. It just doesn't look or feel right. Other problems, all character progression go away once you leave a game which is fine but you can't leave and pick up where you last left off, the levels are all very repetitive, enter an area kill monster, enter another kill monsters, enter an area protect a stationary object from monsters, rinse and repeat, the enemy's are all so similar with slight differences in health and looks with one exception of the boar looking ones who role and have armor In certain spots so as far as I can tell no big bosses like the giant bird they fought in season one, I wouldn't know if there is because I can't make it 20 minutes without getting bored and quitting. You can't customize the resolution because wouldn't change to 1920x1080 it would just revert to 720 after trying to change it, the sound options are a joke, you have voice volume and music volume so I can't turn down anything else so I can't hear anything the characters are saying half the time because so much is going on. The game drops frame rate way to often on my computer that can run Battlefield 3 on full ultra graphics settings and Skyrim with all of the best graphics enhancements mods I could find. So overall the game is really boring and frustrating because of cooperative gameplay turning into competitive gameplay with a story that I don't know because i can't hear what they are saying and putting on subtitles and looking at the subtitles takes me away from the action, I have drop into a quick match in the middle of the game because their is no solo mode and none of my friends own the game. I realize the game is in early access but this is what is what Is wrong with its current state and I do realize that fan boys are going to down vote this because the game is 10/10 perfect no flaws in there eyes but I payed $15 wanting to like it and couldn't bring myself to play it for 20 full minutes.

EDIT: After playing for a little while more I felt like I should add somethings that I like about this game to my otherwise fully negative review, I figured out how to play solo, you have to start a new game which puts you in a lobby and you have to do nothing until everyone else in the lobby gets tired of waiting for you then leaves then put the lobby to friends only, it is really mean to do but I really wanted to play solo and playing through the game I found it to be more enjoyable than a lobby full of people because it brings an actual challenge to the game, also the voice acting is pretty good and the graphics are pretty impressive. The only negative things that weren't mentioned above were that the running animation is not good at all the characters often start floating going up and down stairs and such but this isn't a big problem at all. Another problem is that there are invisible borders everywhere which didn't bother me much. It still is ironic that a RWBY game is more enjoyable solo than Co-op

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Initial Verdict
Excellent game so far, I have currently played as all characters, completed it only with Yang and there are only a few disappointing factors with this game:
-Sometimes when I walk, I can see the animation carries on playing once I stop.
-More than one person can play as each character.
-Extremely short game.
All of those factors will most likely be improved upon (maybe not the several players as one character one) so in all, everything else about the game is amazing! The action is amazing, the graphics are beautiful, and the updates will probably contain some pretty immense stuff! I absolutely love this game and I am glad that I will get to see it grow and expand!

Update:
I have now completed the game as all characters as well as tried out almost all of the skills, I am writing this after trying the Combat Revision opt in beta and I can now begin to see that the game is coming along nicely, there are still no more playable characters or missions but that is to be expected, animations have been greatly improved and in my opinion, the greatest addition to the game so far has to be either the combos in the beta or the camera revision and how it zooms out for combat and pans into the character when walking around.

I still can't wait to see this game expand and know that there won't be a single update that I'm not happy with, also the hype is beginning to sink in for more stories and missions so that'll be cool. I will update this review as the game updates.

First major content update (May 6th 2016):
This new update had me in awe, the Awe yeah" from Ruby Rose welcomed me back into the game and I was greeted with a very red title screen that completely amazed me at how much detail the game now has in it. I started the game
date: this time as Blake (being my favourite of the four in the show) and immediately my eyes were drawn to the thick hair flowing behind her. I thought I was just overthinking things at first but after checking out the other characters I can see the player models have been updated into more 3D and detailed designs that stay truthful to the show whilst adding a unique depthness different from the show.\n\nOne thing that interests me is how they will manage to pull off the "Horde mode" which is an option within the multiplayer mode; it is not currently playable however I believe it will be in the next content update. I'm not going to spoil the new Forever Fall level and to experience what it is truly like you would have to play it for yourself as it is quite... surprising

reviewText:
Early Access Review

6/12/15 Time of review.
For an early access game, it is completely solid and stable. As a big fan of the show from day one episode one I have been following this game since it was on greenlight and I am completely satisfied but that may have something to do with my love for the show. I’ll just talk about what I personally like or dislike so read it if you want detailed information about the game but if you want to short version then I have to say I like the game and I think it’s a great value for money and even greater if you manage to play with a couple of people you know or your just a fan of the show like I am. I do not regret my purchase and am happy to support this game where ever it decides to go.

Pros
GameplayCombat is solid and enjoyable, not very difficult but not very simple either. You can die very easily if you don’t make use of the dodge button and your skills from which there are a good verity between the current four characters of the show. You have your basic combo attacks and a ranged attack which can mix together for a different combo and each of the characters have their own unique skills which use a portion of your skill bar. You can also upgrade your skills by levelling your character, which add some unique effects or just upgrade general things such as your aura which acts as your health. You gain one skill point per level, at the moment the max level is ten so you have a total of ten points to spend but again that could be only for now and could change later. Picking between which skills you want to upgrade more and focus towards is completely up to you and from what I’ve seen there isn’t a TRINITY between skills at the moment. But then again I only play Ruby and Yang so take my word for a grain of sand :P The game is also four player drop in and drop out co-op so you can have some great fun with friends or random people, enemies do increase in difficulty depending on how many people are with you so it doesn’t make the game easier in a sense. However I must say there is no lock on system which is kind of weird, it makes son skills completely miss the enemy you want to hit and sometimes hits the wrong one. You kind of get use to it as you keep playing but still, adding a lock on will fix this issue. It should also be mentioned that this game supports Xbox One and PS4 controller support surprisingly, the controls on a keyboard and mouse are perfectly fine in my opinion but the option is there for those who want it. I do not own a controller for either console so I can’t fully recommend them as I have no idea if they are a blessing or a curse but again the option is there.

SoundSound is decent I guess, there is a track what plays through missions and sometimes have these epic tracks playing during large battles and boss fights which puts a smile on your face now and then. Voice acting is also here and for the most part works well, every character sounds like their own and isn’t a pain to listen to but then again I watch allot of anime so maybe that has something to do with it. Sound effects are spot on, you feel like your attacks are connecting and your specials are in fact SPECIAL. Not much else I can really say, I think it’s all great and works just as intended but it is worth mentioning that it does get a bit too loud especially the combat sounds. It just gets ridiculously loud for no reasons but again its nothing game breaking so…YOLO I guess.

GraphicsGraphics are just as they are in the show which is a very and I mean VERY GOOD THING. It all looks right by nature and stays true to its origin. If you aren’t a fan of a cartoony style with an anime flare then walk away now because it is not getting any better than it is. The character models are perfect and represent the player characters and the enemy NPC’s perfectly. I personally love Yang’s hair as it’s the best thing to look at while laying the beat down on grimm :P

Cons
LevelsLevels are a hit and miss for me, they serve their function with flying colours and there is nothing wrong with them in a sense. The problem is that there are way TOO many invisible walls for no real reason. For example during the first two missions where you play in large fields, you can see large open areas which you can’t get to because there’s an inviable force stopping you. It makes levels feel like a straight line, a corridor not allowing the players to explore these good looking areas in a large and interesting world. That said there are a good amount of secrets on each map which grant extra EXP which are very easy to miss but worth getting if you can so for that I will thank the designer, it does give the players a reason to actually explore the area than just go on with the objective. Also some missions have these “defend the objective” goal which isn’t bad for me since I like the combat enough but I can see if people start to get annoyed by this so mixing up the objective would be nice. That’s not to say that’s the only thing you do because it’s not.

AnimationsAnimations are a mixed bag here, for the characters you control they are spot on. Each character feels unique and has a unique play style which makes you want to main a charter over the others which is always a good thing as you feel connect to these charter especially if you watch the show, I personally absolutely love Yang but will defiantly play Raven if she gets added. It’s the enemy NPCs who have issues now and then, for example Weiss can freeze an enemy in place with one of her upgrades but for some reason the enemy still attacks and even move around despite being frozen in ice. What the hell? It happens a hand full of times but way more common as you play more and more so hopefully that can get fixed.

SkillsSkills for some characters are clearly better than others, for example Yang’s third ability “Blastwave” is completely worthless and unreliable as you miss your targets five out of ten times. Making the upgrades for that ability a complete waste. Another example is Ruby’s general upgrade “Armor piercing rounds” which increases the damage of your range attacks, why? This is a game where you have to combo enemy’s to even use your skills, range attacks are nice to have but don’t even get close to the same damage as your melee attacks do. So why have an upgrade for something you barely use? It may not be bad as I’m making it out to be but it does make you scratch your head now and then especially since you can currently only getting a total of ten points to spend, so you want to be sure your making you right decisions. It just when you have a good damaging ability you should have other good options which are comparably not a liability.

Conclusion
It’s a very solid game to play and enjoy especially if you have friends so if you’re a fan of the show then show your support and pick this up. Get some friends and you will have some great fun as I have with my friends. Really excited to see how this game will grow and hopefully it will be for the better. All in all I have not regretted my purchase at all.

What I would like to see in the future.
More characters. (Please add Raven! I’ll pay whatever the price)
More levels because why not?
Remove the invisible walls or at least make then less noticeable.
Change some of the skills so they make more sense.
A character creator.
If possible, a PvP mode. It would be awesome putting a team like RWBY vs JNPR.

8/10 needs more Raven.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nBEST GAMEPLAY WITH BEST WAIFU

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, a little about me and how I'll try all my might to not have this review be biased. I'm a huge fan of Roosterteeth, RWBY has been one of those series that have taken my heart and I am in love with this show, the world, the character, the concepts- everything. When I heard an official game was in the works, I swear I cried. Now that it's in my possesion, I was so excited to play this game, I expected a whole lot from a company so invested in video games, you'd think they'd get everything right.

So far, I'd say they got enough right for this game to be actually enjoyable- even if this is still a day one review.

I'm only gonna summarize the game a bit. You and your team are a four-man squadrant composed of teenage girls with powerful weapons. You can pick one of these lovely girls to be in while you battle. These characters are Ruby Rose, Yang Xiao Long, Blake Belladonna, Weiss Schnee. Not gonna go over their characters, and I'm not gonna explain what they're doing or why they're here. The combat system is basically, spam left click, press some buttons, and try to defeat all the Grimm, (the strange monsters,) in the stage at that moment. When you join a game, you are basically going through a campaign, and once the campaign
date:
(I'm using the term loosely, because I think this is the only thing that really decribes this progression though the game,) is over, you return to the party screen, and restart the campaign. Now, lets get on to the looks and what not. You gain experience through combat, you can unlock powerups to your existing 3 special moves, and your health bar is the Aura bar at the bottom right. It depletes, you have a few seconds to dodge hits and not get hit again before you die. If you don't recieve damage for a certain amount of time, your health fills up, and you're able to go back to hacking and slashing your way through the game.

Visually, this game is quite nice. The scenery surrounding you is wonderful, the character models are quite nicely done, and, (even if this is just the Day 1 review,) the animations are actually more glitch-free than I thought they would be. There are times where the walk cycle glitches out and the character model is stuck in the same pose as it walks down the stairs, but generally, the animations are fluid. The grim get the same issues when they are pushed against a wall, their walk cycles turn a bit wonky, but it's still nice. The GUI is lackluster, but this is early access, I wouldn't be surprised if it gets updated. The main menu GUI is simplistic, and that's totally fine, but the in-game gui is a bit confusing to get used to. I'm personally not used to looking at the bottom right corner of my games, because I usually get notifications there.

If someone logs into skype while you're playing this game, and you have notifications on- your aura bar is gone from sight and you only have some visual cues and audio cues to tell you that you need to get the hell out of there. (Added note; I would have also enjoyed being able to see the aura of my other teammates, and even their specials bar. It could make for easier coordination and teamwork, [this could also take away from the idea of a hack and slash, maybe, but coordination and teamwork are always fun.])

The BGM and voice acting are a nice touch though, I enjoy listening to all the quips and quirky one-liners characters say at the end of waves or stages. It's entertaining. I have to say though, there are instances where there were character dialog subtittled at the bottom, (because I like having subtitles on,) and their small character picture to the left was speaking, but an entirely different character's voice came through. Example; Yang's picture and subtitles were on the screen, but I heard Ruby instead.

Now, the actual campaign
recommended:
(I seriously don't know what to call this,) follows team RWBY through a forest, through some ruins, underground, and then to the location of a bomb. Seriously. I appreciate the idea of incorporating so many different meathods of playing the game. It goes from a simple, stage by stage fight, then to defending a point, back to stage by stage, then another defend the point, some more waves of Grimm, and then the last part. The bomb part. This part of the whole game is by far the hardest part to do alone. I would know, my team ditched me and I had to get the bomb to the end on my own. Did I succeed? Nope. a 85% the bomb exploded and I was a sad sally, but you know, life moves on, and I figured this game was going to be impossible to play without teammates. If you also want a four player experience throughout the campaign, I'm going to tell you now, you're not going to get it. I've never been able to finish with all 4 characters present, people drop out way too fast when things get dicey. This is also a positive thing, because the game recognizes this and changes the difficulty, which is a plus.

I quickly added this part before I posted the review, but I have to say, the combat between Ruby, Blake, and Weiss are strikingly similar and gets repetitive. While on the other hand, Yang's combat is lackluster compared to them. They all have AOE or large attacks that affect a multitude of enemies around them, while Yang has her two special punches, and a ground pound with the radius of a corn nut. It made my experience while playing Yang make me feel like I wasn't doing as much work as the rest of the team. She does make up for it by her ability to have her full specials bar come back in almost an instant, but still, her combat is the only one with slight difference in comparison to the other characters who can swoop in, use an AOE and steal all of the kills. All of 'em.

Speaking of teammates, I kind of want a single player version of this. Maybe a training mode where your teammates are really idiotic CPUs who let you have all the kills- just so someone could get used to the controls. But this is, yet again, something I want and if it doesn't get added, I won't be mad. I also won't be mad if you don't buy this game. It's not for everyone, and it's the best game yet. (Nor will it ever be, maybe.)

Either way, this is a wonderful start for this game's Early Access and here's probably why you should, or shouldn't get it. I'm also not summing up anything I said in Pro's and Con's because I'm lazy.

I am also too lazy to stop myself from doing it.

Pro's;
- Graphically wonderful with pretty fluid animations.
- Non-Overbaring story that guides you though the game, (good for people who don't actually know RWBY.)
- Difficulty changes dependent on player count.
- Exotic scenery and character designs make this more unique than other franchises, (which makes it good for the game also.)

Con's;
- Unbalanced Audio, (voice acting too quiet, special moves overbaringly loud, etc.)
- Repetitive Combat
- Early Access


Should you get this game? I'd say yes if you like RWBY, like unfinished games, and enjoy watching cute girls battle monsters. In any other case, just wait till it's out of Early Access, or more updated.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's a pretty fun game, especially if you (like myself) are a RWBY fan. However there are currently quite a few issues / things that need to be improved upon. To list a few: more variation in combat would be nice, escpecially with ranged attacks (they are pretty weak and pretty much keep your character from moving while your are firing). There definately needs to be more balancing with player health vs damage done by enemies, and the special attacks bar needs to be easier to refill since it requires you to get combos to refill (which is very difficult to do later on, when you frequently become surrounded). There also needs to be more encouragement for working as a team and there needs to be more exploration allowed. I would also like to see more customization for your character, more indepth skill trees, and possibly more gamemodes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is great! Still early , But shows signs of a well made game with great potential.

The Pros of the game:

Graphics
Music
Characters
Gameplay
Story

The Cons of the game:

Music levels by default aren't set very well
subtitles aren't to the word of the audio ( thats norm for a lot of games anyway)
Gameplay can be a little repetative but was expected from the style. Does get harder at times.
Story seems to be set mid way into season 3 of the series, Unsure as of yet . All I know is its further than the series.

The Characters:

Ruby: By far the all-round strongest, Main Character . there are 3 special attacks that each character can do. One is a shot or long range attack 2nd one is a heavy single unit attack. And 3rd is a area of attack. Ruby hold the best for area attacks and has a decent long range shot. her single power attack isn't as good but after playing them all, Ruby is by far the strongest.

Weiss: Fast percise and agile. Weiss Focuses on single targets more than a group. Her group attack is awful from the 4 of them. she is best at her single unit attack or her long range attack as she uses dust to attack.I found I lacked a lot of points and kills while playing as Weiss but I played more of a medic".

Blake: The first character I played as
date:
Fast great at combo hits and has a decent all round spec. Doesn't excel in anything but is a key player in the field. I find you will be shooting more with blake than any of the others. blake could also handle any situation on the spot without struggling as much as some did.

Yang: The best Single unit attack and great at giving the team some "space" with her mighty shotguns! Yang was a great teammate who was better in single unit attacks than the others. Was also a slower but more "tank" character.

Summary: The game sticks close to the series in its good ways
recommended: with it still early Access and ideas changing all the time. I found the game very smooth to run and the control system was great! Some characters had auto aim for their weapons

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fantastic! First off, I've been a fan of the show since day one, so I'm a little biased. Also, this is in early access, so I don't count its flaws against it.

The game is an absolute blast. Fast paced action, well designed enemies, playing as Team RWBY is extremely well done. Also the graphics are nice, looks very much like the show, but could still use some polishing.

On the downside, it's terribly unoptimized. Hang-ups everywhere. I have a GTX 860M and had to take it to Potato" quality at 720p to evade the hang-ups. Connectivity isn't the best
date: but once you're in a party with good connection it works fine. The animations are a bit clunky. I feel like the jumping could use some work. Also
recommended: button mapping would be greatly appreciated. Finally
hoursPlayed: the audio quality is... weird. It sounds super-compressed.\n\nHowever it's extremely impressive that they've managed to put this out with such a small team! Rooster Teeth continues to amaze me with how much they get done between so few people. It would be a dream to work on a project like that. Awesome job

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I understand its an early access game but there is alot problems
1. soft crashes
2. my progress got deleted
3. the level resets to last checkpoint when host switches
4. always online causes lag
personal gripes
1. needs single player, practice mode, and local co-op
2. a queue so every online level has one of every member
3. no shared EXP.
4. explanation of abilities before unlocked
5, ofcourse, more characters
All in all its still a good game that extends the RWBY universe and has solid combat and in depth gameplay. not the best hack and slash I've ever played because of too simple controls but far from the worst and is worth playing; hopefully more so when in final form.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game, this gem, is really a wonderful experience. Even though for now you will have to have watched the series before being able to play this game knowing what and who everyone is, it already has so much potential. For a hack and slash game this doesn't come short in any way. It's fun, get's you to do and see lot's of things and overall is something you can immerse fully into. The game might get repetitive after a while because it is only in it's beginning stages where the campaign isn't at it's full length. But! Every character and their style is unique in lots of ways. Try Ruby and then Weiss for a change, you'll notice you have to work up more experience to build a bit of a skill level with either. Overall I would say I love this game and it hasn't let me down ever since I onced wished Santa Rooster Teeth Claus to bring out a game as awesome as the series can be! Lot's of potential to make an awesome game! Maybe even Player vs Player tournaments? ;)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

!WARNING!
This game only has 3 missions at the time of this review which can be solo'd in a space of 20 mins

TL;DR at the bottom

The core of the game mechanics are there. It really does feel like a Hack n' Slash just like Dynasty Warriors, except there isn't thousands of grimm to slaughter. You get to play as team RWBY, each has a basic attack, long range attack and 3 specials. The combat is smooth except for the long range attacks and specials, with thes you can end up shooting the ground instead of hitting the grimm rying to eat you. I believe some sort of lock-on mechanic would be able to fix this.
The upgrade system is.....well functional. You need to do earn certain achievements to unlock certain skills and bonuses that increases your special damage, your aura(HP), aura recharge rate and special bar(used to activate specials). But due to the current short nature of the game, you'll only be able to get a small amount of these upgrades (I managed lvl 10 by the end of the 3rd mission).
The game features a fluid difficulty, the more players, the harder it is. Soloing it is childs play while a full party of 4 people is still childs play. I feel the game is lacking difficulty, I find it that the presence of the grimm is not menancing enough and really easy to clear out, soloing or in a full party.

The glismp of the story we get  is interesting which adds a little bit more lore to the RWBY universe and does not require the show to understand it (would be helpful to get to know the characters). Would like to see how the full story plays out.

Graphics wise, would be similar to a JRPG, and has 3 settings, Potato ( can't believe this was actually a setting), Normal and Ultra. I also find no difference between Normal and Ultra. There's multiple  resolution options to chose from.

I do find people are disconnecting a lot in parties, which the hosts are usuaslly are blamed, but I find it unlikely that every host has bad connection. So the server seems to need some tweaking for proper multi-player experience.

TL;DR
Bare bones of the game, fighting mechanics are there, barely any story. Only recommend if you're a massive fan of the show and want to support this game production.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll make this short. This is an amazing game. It has a lot of potential and I will be updating this review as there are more updates to the game. I can't stress how amazing this game feels, but note it is like 5% done. I wouldnt even call it an alpha, I would call it a ploit, a pre-alpha, even a concept.
POINT: If your fine with the fact that you are spending $17 on an pre-alpha that literally only has a bare bones structure, then buy this now.
Seriously, it has nothing yet, no save progress, no loot, not a great combo system.
The only thing it offers now is online co op and beating up certain grimm enemies.  Everything else is not fully developed yet, hence the early access.
NOTE: Don't read the other review about the pro and cons about the game. They are judging a game that is in early access and not even close to completed.

If you are not ok with buying a game that is not even close to being done, then dont buy this yet. Wait for it to get out of early access or at least wait for it to have a bit more elements to the game.
If you made it this far in this review. Then honestly, this game is amazing and will be worth your money. It shows so much potential and I can not wait for it to get more updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

~ Early Access Review ~

Out of my four hours of experience, I can confindently say this game is good for early access and most likely when its released as a full game.
However I haven't watched the anime yet which is a mistake on my part.

PROS:
- Good Character Movement
- Skills are easily implemented (simplistic to use)
- Level Designs have a nice feel to them and they look nice
- Damage with average weapons are perfect!
- Controls! They recommend a controller but it is perfectly fine to use a keyboard.
In fact I think it is better to use a keyboard

CONS:
- Skills at times can be op (overpowered)
- The hidden walls in some areas can be annoying
- XP is somewhat a problem, it is not equally shared. Which can be frustrating

POSSIBILITIES:
- Tweaking the Leveling system (XP etc)
- Tweaking the Levels a little
- More Skills!
- Accessorises or clothing would be a nice touch to customise a character (this could be gained through killing the monster things or doing challenges)
- Voice Chat maybe?

For an early access game and with the price being £10.99 (United Kingdom) I think it should be a game everyone should test out if they love Anime games or a Hack n slash but I would keep in mind the fact it is currently an EARLY ACCESS GAME.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you like RWBY (the show) and you like beat 'em ups, you will probably like this (it's basically a love letter to fans).  If you have no idea what RWBY is, go to YouTube, look up RWBY Season 1 Episode 1 : Ruby Rose" and start watching right now. Remember Haloid? Dead Fantasy? Red vs. Blue? The creator(s) of all three of those are behind this series.  It basically runs on the TV Trope "Rule of Cool."  (Yeah
date:
you're now going to spend the rest of your day on TV Tropes.  You're welcome.)

Visuals and Sound: Holy crap they're actually using the character models from the show itself and the real voice actors but they need more lines and *squeeeeeeee*
Gameplay: "FUN BUT BUGGY."  To be expected from a title which has literally been in Early Access for less than two weeks as of this writing.  That being said I'd be remiss in not critiquing this
recommended: as that's the point of Early Access -- feedback.\n\n* Lots of invisible walls are frustrating
hoursPlayed: especially when it's not immediately apparent why you can jump off one ledge
voteText: but not off of another ledge which visually looks exactly the same.  @Devs: If you're going to do this
helpfulPercent: please add some visual aid like a fence to explain why we can't jump off something.  Current invisible wall placements feel arbitrary
votesHelpful: especially in The Emerald Forest.\n\n* Left-click combos tend to automatically go into the air after the first couple of clicks
votesTotal: which can be annoying if you intentionally do not want to go into the air and want to stay on the ground and keep slashing.  @Devs: Need more control over combo attack directions.  I mean I wasn't going into this expecting a Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance level of combat complexity but you may want to look at that game for ideas!\n\n* Aiming gun modes (right click) is frustrating as you have seemingly little to no control over where you're aiming and have to have faith in ye gods of autoaim to hit the right target.  Devs: Please
votesFunny: please look at Dark Souls and Metal Gear Rising and Phantasy Star Online for examples on how to do auto-lock-on targeting well.\n\nAs this is an Early Access title
commentsCount: this review will be updated after my next RWBY:GE session (especially with the next version).\n\nIf you read through all this
column16: please leave a comment! :)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I didn't regret buying this game even its in the state of Early Access. Its one of the best hack & slash games I've played so far. Currently there's only 1 campaign that you can play with. The people in this community are pretty nice. Most of them are English speaking al least. If you are a non-english speaker then you shouldn't be playing international games since you can't communicate using english at all. Its pretty hard playing with someone who speaks in a foreign language to begin with.

This game focuses more in Teamwork. You may be bad at playing this game at all but don't lose hope. Your team is there trying to help you at times of defeat. I love how unique the leaderboard is all about that it only shows at the end of the match. I hope it stays until the end of the development. If the leaderboard can be shown at will then it'll be a competitive trying to aim for the MvP, that'll ruin the game.

Note:
- Is it worth the price? I don't think so (as of the moment) but for the graphics then YES it is.
- You might wanna buy this game during sale or you might regret from what you've saved up unless you are happy and rich.
- If you think this game is nice and cool then pay it with full price to support the developers and the game's development.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To be blunt, this game is a yes and a no. Why? Well, depends on how much you know and like about RWBY.

Granted, the gme is currently in its early development stage, which shows that it can become a promiing game for anybody who decides to pick it up. But, as it is now, it features four color coded girls with some crazy weapons destroying hordes of black creatures. That's... kind of what RWBY is in the first place. But, hey! I love it.

The game is an action packed beat 'em up with a feel similar to Devil May Cry, but not there yet. The game will be fleshed out later as it releases its full version. You pick one of four characters, each different but similar. They each have a standard combo, some which knock the enemy into the air and your character assaults it from there, and each has a ranged attack, which has the most variation of all of them. The special attacks are all similar as well, each character having an area attack, an attack good against single high level enemies, and a long ranged special. While they are all different in effect, visual, and feel, they all follow that same catagory. While this may seem like a negative thing, I find beautiy in this. While each character has their own quirks and battle style, I don't have to worry about whether or not I will be able to hold off multiple foes or be concerned with facing off against one. The characters all feel different, but they all have the same foundation; this is something I find intriguing and applaud the creator for doing (I can't remember his name...)

The game has it's pros, being fun, action packed fights that do indeed have a difficulty to them where I don't feel as though I reign as a god because the enemies attacks can hurt you if you don't pay attention. With an environment, storyline, and characters that has all RWBY fans whooping in celebration for one of the things they couldn't wait for, there are some negative quirks that will most likely be fixed. First off, your character level is not saved. You restart every time you play. The game is obviously a trial, as there are only four levels to play, after which you are whisked back to the main menu where you will either try again as another character or find something else to play. The game feels like it has a rookie" feel

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a fan of the RWBY-series I was all hyped when I found out it would get its own game on Steam.
It didn't help with the trailer of the game, which made me look almost every day for updates about Early Access!

Finally it came out and I didn't even care about the costs, I just wanted the bloody game. And I was not disappointed. Being in Early Access stage I figured it would lack a lot of content and have several flaws, but just the little that was already done made me quickly recommend it to others. I love playing as Ruby, especially since she's my favorite character. Even more do I love to see places that I recognize and figuring out ways to handle challenging enemies like the bearlike Grimm (it's probably the deadliest one since I just can't interrupt its attacks).

The characters in this game varies in difficulty, which again varies from player to player. I've heard others say that Blake and Weiss are easy to handle, while Yang and Ruby are harder, while I have the opposite opinion. The skill-tree for each character is nice as it gives each player the opportunity to play in their styles. An example is for instance that I love the Crescentos-ability as it hits everyone around me and I'm quite good at entering a massive horde, activate Crescentos and then get some distance between me and the remaining Grimm, just to repeat it until a few are left standing, easy to take out.

What I miss is more ways to play the game. Currently it's pretty much straight forward and gets boring over time. And treasures and XP-boosts are always in the same places, meaning you can't get much excitement of treasure hunting" and try to find the stuff before your companions
date: as everyone who's found the stuff before knows pretty much where it is.\n\nAs the game is still under development
recommended: one cannot really complain about the lack of content
hoursPlayed: only about the quality of the existing content. This is why I feel it is wrong to say that this game gets boring because it is short and repeatively. However I do hope that this game will give the player more variety in the future
voteText: perhaps even several game modes like participation in the Vytal Festival
helpfulPercent: missions with a separate team (like JNPR) and perhaps a social platform where one can explore the cities and do other stuff peacefully (or violently if you're of that type. Though I doubt it will happen in this game
votesHelpful: it would be fun if people could create their own characters and form their own teams one day
votesTotal: for instance in a ranked contest or something.\n\nNow enough of my crazy ideas
votesFunny: in overall I would give this a 7/10 as it still needs to work on some things to be one of the more "perfect" games."
