reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nReally awesome what the Roosterteeth guys are doing and so far loving the early build of the game. Although it isn't perfect and there are definite improvements that can be made, the potential is through the roof for this game. Initially I got a very bayonetta and KH vibe from the game just from the overall feel too it. It stays true to the hack and slash genre and incorporates a relatively basic attack system. The combat consists of 3 specials, a basic meele attack, and a ranged attack. In the future I hope to see a more combo oriented combat style with the requirements of being able to weave all three together. Another thing they NEED to add is a quicker way to level each special attack. A huge annoyance during my gameplay experience was being unable to level abilities without risking being KO'd. Another thing I would like to touch on with the combat is the grimm. I liked the mix of grimm chosen, each provided a different combat style you needed to recognize and adapt too. However it seemed to easy to dodge each Grimm's special moves, more noticably the Borbatusk and the Ursa. All you would need to do is stop attacking and press SHIFT (dodge) when the Grimm would flash white. In the future adding more difficult timing and a multitude of attacks for each Grimm would keep players on their toes and actually punish them for making mistakes. My final critique on the combat is the lack of teamwork needed to play this game. Although I don't expect it yet from such an early build, the addition of team attacks and combos would not only stay true to the show but make the overall experience more submersive. Currently it boils down to who can secure kills and steal the most XP possible. The leveling system is also very strange. I would personally like them to take a skill tree route rather than the MOBA like leveling they have chosen. It feels extremely akward and doesn't seem to work in a 4 campaign game. Overall the game needs work but for being such an early build the potential for it is extremely exciting! I recommend to buy the game only if you are a fan of Roosterteeth and RWBY. If not then I would wait until more changes and updates are added to help create a full experience. Overall I give it a 6/10 for an early access but the potential is through the roof.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

RWBY Grim Eclipse IS THE gaem based on the series RWBY by roostertootho,  a hack&slash Co-op action anime game where you play as Ruby, Weiss,Blake or Yang,
All i know of the story is that The horribul grim has come to wolrd and then you go and kill them all.

RWBY is a hack&slash Co-op action anime game, where you kill grim and complete objectives given by some old guy and later some nerd.

the game's difficulty rises as new enemies are introduced, but most of their moves are easy to learn and pown their asses.
Also the more players there are the harder it is to beat the enemies as the difficulty is adjusted.

The maps are pretty linear, with a few parts leading to an artifact or some boxes that contain experience so finding the artifacts doesn't require much effort.

Gameplay Mechanics

Gameplay is fast, not too complex, and easy to master.
Smash the attack button, shoot your gun or magic, execute special moves, dodge. GG, killing enemies grants you special bars that are required to execute special moves, depending on their
level they require different amount, for example fully upgraded aoe attack requires two bars of special, you level up your
character and can distribute points to upgrade your stats, aura or abilites.

Enemies have red dots and glow white when they are about to execute an attack move, so you know when to dodge, some enemies only have the red dots over their head when attacking.

Dodging itself works well, if you just blindly dodge all the time you will get hit, so timing is required.

Graphics. the layout in the world could be better, but overall the game looks beautiful.

For some reason i get fps drops at 1080p, even though i have beast pc, dont know why maybe it's just server lag


Some bugs/annoyances

Sometimes when you do an aoe attack the enemies are not affected, and they just stand there like nothing happened.

you cant hit enemies that are starting or in middle of an attack move, same goes with if you are doing a special attack, then you cannot be hit, this can
be seen when charging an aoe attack.

Running is slow but there is sprinting in the game, it's on the dodge button so you dodge and keep holding the button to sprint.

Animations look a bit too fast on some moves, like Yang jumping and shooting, looks like shes shooting from between her legs. The running animation gets stuck
for a little while but then continues normally, other than that i dont understand what people are complaining how the animations are really horrible, to me most of them
look smooth, considering its early access, ♥♥♥♥ like this should in my opinion be forgiven.

In some places You can rotate the camera and see inside the world and even go inside the world. 	the world the world inside the wolrrldlsdlsdl insde the world the inside world wordl the sindetiete

Sometimes theres just so many enemies following you that it is difficult to start killing them, and with no special you just have to dash in there and somehow get a few kills
or hope that someone saves your ♥♥♥.



Controls.

Controller works very well, and the camera is easy to control , and i had no issues at with it.
only sometimes dodging didn't work, but i might have not been pushing the button agressively enough.


Replaybility
The other characters.. nothing else really.
There are some ablities that require you to have 300 kills to get some better upgrade for it
and the kill counts does stay on characters you have  already played with
if you played the game alone then you can have quick fun with your friends

Sound
I found the music to be very good, no clipping and it is not distracting, and during a boss fight badass metal starts playing
the health regen sound i found to be too bassy, like the constant WOOOOM sound when losing health because of a hard situation, does get annoying.
The voice acting is good, sometimes it does feel a bit forced.., YAY we win part

Cinematics,,
There are only two cinematic sections currently in the game and they play out smoothly, just the fire effect in the explosion is cheap.

Price
Currently the game costs 15buks or 15 euro's, For an early access game with barely an hour of content, that is alot.. unless you are like me and like to play
with all the characters, enjoy this kind of Hack and slash games then you got almost 4 hours, of fun so it's not a bad price, who knows if the price goes up, after more content is released
and how many anime kawaii gurl hack & slash games are there on pc anyway?
So i say its a good purchase, there is alot of potential for this game and i hope they make it a great baddassss ♥♥♥♥♥
cos this is just the kind of game i've been waiting for, for years.

The Pro's, the cons and the Scoring


Pro's
Fastpaced gameplay
4 charaters, (Anime gurls)
Easy controls
somewhat challenging but not too difficult, or too easy.
Easy learning curve, if any.


Cons
short for now, Barely 1 hour of gameplay with 1 character playthrough.
15 bucks
annoying bugs

Now for some scoring
Scoring
Gameplay 9/10
Graphics 9/10
Animations 6/10
controls 8/10
Soundtrack 8/10
Replayability 7/10

Overall score 7.8 Good Game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly as of right now I can recommend this game and here are a list of reasons why you should get it and why you shouldn't. I honestly thinks its worth te $14.99!

Pros:

Graphics - The game looks great and it looks amazing on ultra settings. The characters looks just like the ones from the show and the art style is great. Nothing for me to complain about here.

Combat - The battle style in the game is unique. It can be repetitive if your playing alone but if your playing with a group of friends at max difficulty the combat is anything but repetitive. I like all the characters and their abilities.

Voice Acting - The characters are voiced by the same people in the show which really made me happy because I RWBY is a great Anime/Show. Whichever you like to call it.

Exploration - People might think its not worth much but there are hidden artifacts to help you level up throughout each level and destroying the boxes help give players xp so I recommend that you explore the map and take advantage of this.

Abilities - Some are generic but your characters combat abilities are great. Each character kinda has its own playstyle and abilities and then they have the set of abilities that all characters can unlock. For example of a generic ability, is that you can revive people faster. Also I like the fact that you have to do challenges to unlock the abilities. Makes the game more fun.

Cons:

Sound - The game was really loud for me and I mean mostly the combat and footsteps. You can turn down music and voice but the combat and footsteps stay the same. I think it would be nicer if players had the option to turn that stuff down. Luckily I went to Volume mixer and lowered my game.

Amount of Current Content - It's lacking levels and characters. The game is great and I know its early access so yes players can be expecting more content to come and I know that its going to get more levels but right now there are currently only four levels and its can be boring after a few playthroughs.

Walking - When your characters walking sometimes their feet start to glitch and its kind of funny. Its just a small bug and the developers will surely fix it.

*NOTE* - I will be updating this as the game continues to release more content. Thanks for reading this and I hoped it help.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is . . . . alright.  I enjoy it as a mix between MOBA and Tecmo-Koei's various Warriors series.

Pros

The game is pretty fun, and the abilities make for a pretty unique experiance for any players.

Our awsome game designers always inform us when an update is coming, send us teaser images, and are planning to implement the duetaganist(s) of RWBY Jaune Arc, Nora Valkiry, Pyrrha Nikos, and Lie Ren of team JNPR.

New shader gives the game a look of its own compared to the show.
Cons

Obivous one, the shader gives the game a look different of the show.  (Some people like it, some don't, I personally am just happy to have the dang thing)

The max level is 10, so if you like seeing numbers go up, well I'm sorry.

Certain abilities are locked behind 'acheivment walls' meaning you have to do certain things to unlock them.  (Understandable since the powers are strong enough to become a game changer like Wiess's Barrage ability.)

When defeating grimm, only the person who lands the finishing blow gets EXP. (Team attacks, if you can react (shoot now I have to pay the Fine Brothers) fast enough give about thirty experiance to the players who made the enemy vunerable and who followed up.  Letting you know this, I hadn't been watching the exp bar last time I played, so The first part may not be true.
Can I recommend this game?  The answer is a firm yes.  Just want you to know what you're getting into.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I managed to get my hands on this game thanks to the Anime sale and I have to say that it was totally worth my money. Not only do I get to play as 1 of 4 members of team RWBY, I also get to experience a story that isn't a rehash of the series.

There are only two things I wish the game had:
1. I wish the shooting had an option between rapid fire and going through the shoot combo sequence. Example: there are times where I would want to just continuously shoot with Blake's pistol and times where I would need the extra range from her slash wave. Having the choice would be very useful especially in terms of strategy.
2. The option (not a requirement) to make a room where only one of every member of RWBY is allowed. It gets a bit boring and weird when you have 4 Rubys in one team and everyone is doing the same thing. It can be fun, yes, but also a bit chaotic and it lacks diversity.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really really really love this game. But what will happen if you have updates? Like, what will happen, free or paid ? Cause if paid, I'm out \o/.

But, other wise, I would like to say a few things about it.

SOME GOOD THINGS!:

- Good character design, great art, actually a little better than the actual show.
- Amazing skills. I love the charge system and the point system. Great show.
- Little lag, if you have a good computer (descent atleast)
- Good voice acting
- Good story reveal

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NOTE: This review is based on the 1st day early access so this is all subjective to change.

I found the game to be well designed and thought out.  The action in my opinion makes it an interesting and fun hack and slash games and probably one of the few I have personally enjoyed.  The ranking up and skill acquisition gives the game some additional purpose.

The main pros are that it is being produced by the creators of the series, rooster teeth.  The voice actors all played their roles which gives extra credibility to the game itself.  The game is very easy to grasp hold of and I managed to competently play it within a minute.  Which is good because complex games can lose thier interest quickly.

The cons or constructive critacism lies in a few areas.  FIrstly and this has been mentioned by many others is that the voices are quite soft.  Second is an where the player stops running yet the legs keep on animating a walk or run sequence for a second or two after.  Some additional characters/teams from the series would really make this game better.  I could see it getting repetative if were just the same four main characters.  This is a general issue I have found with most hack and slash games.  Some additional combos and or animations for attacks would also be a nice addition.

I do realise that this was an early release (today) but so far I really like where this is heading.  The main menu design is set up well and easy to use and the game itself is also very quick to learn and a lot of fun.  I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a good hack and slash game and of course fans of RWBY.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

RWBY: Grimm Eclipse is a fun game, of course its not the best game ever of all time, it could be better in many ways, but I do think it will be way better as time goes on as they add more places, characters and features etc...

tl;dr: If you like RWBY get, if you don't know what a RWBY is watch the show then get it.

If you're like me and are a die hard fan for RWBY and basically anything Rooster Teeth, I recommend getting it. I've played it way too much and enjoyed every hour, testing out everything for all Team RWBY and loved playing each one of them (Except maybe for Weiss, not becasue she's bad or anything but becasue I just don't like her, sorry not sorry)

Now if your not a big RWBY fan I won't say don't get it, I want them to get as much support as they can, but if you don't watch the show you won't really know a great deal of who you are, what and why you're fighting, or really feel connected to the world of Remnant in the slightest. But hey, I think you'll have some fun with it.

But if you like fairly simple hack-n-slash games with a cool art stlye and amazing music with the support of one of the best companys as well one of the best communties behind it, get it and who knows maybe you'll start watching the show if you haven't already.

P.S. You hold dodge to sprint (so many people I play with don't know that)

P.P.P.S. Please if you add a difficulty setting just make it to where it just adds more ememies, please don't just make them stronger or that we get weaker, thank you.

Thank you to everyone working on this game, I love it so much and can't wait to see where you all take it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

RWBY: Grimm Eclipse (Beta) is a good game so far! It's not as good as you would like it to be and rough around the edges as a hack & slash type game. The game is in beta or Early access so don't expect too much out of it except for fanboy/fangirl characters you wanted to play as or fighting along side.

-PROS:
*The lag is barely noticeable & get to play with people
*The Controls are nice for an Early Access and hope they improve it
*The Whole RWBY team is avalible for play and have their different attacks based on their style
*The voice acting for english is actually very well done! Keep up the good work!
*Style & Graphics maybe rough but it'll grow on you like part of the world during gameplay

-CONS
*No single player: Seriously, there is none whatsoever and you're always online which kinda sucks
*No Character Creation: Not really a con but it'll be great to fight along side the RWBY team or have your own attacks
*Many people can be the same character: I literally had 3 yangs on one team. Funny though but so much yellow ...
*No control Mapping: It's actually hack & slash friendly but no option to change for other people
*No other characters besides team RWBY: I would like to see more characters besides the main team.
*Graphics: a Small problem but you look like you're walking on air and the style needs to be flourished more (to me).
*The biggest problem I have with the game is the attacks and Leveling. once you comeplete 3 stages you beat the early access game story line. Once you start again you go back to level 1 no matter what and some of the perks are locked due to challenge you have to complete. Not having a save feature for this level is much to be desired but it's early access so probably in due time

-SUMMARY:
Even though it may have a ton of cons in this review but the pros outweigh it by light years if only the game wasn't $15. I wish this was a bigger project so you can be another character or be one in the series. The Combat needs to be improved along side the stats so you can feel like you're actually getting better. Though as it's a beta it's fine! Just wish there was more and hope it doesn't catch the early access cold where this is the game as most like H1Z1 did to other people.Other than that, Most cof the cons can be a Pro which is a very big plus on this game and wish they follow up with it.

RWBY: Grimm Ecipse is not a buy it now ... rather keep a close eye on it with a lot of potentia!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I made a firm decision to never buy anything in early access after getting burned one too many times. However, I've been a long-time fan of Roosterteeth and I follow RWBY with a passion. I also played the original fan-made version and the pre-alpha on the Roosterteeth site. So boy howdy did I buy this as soon as it went up.

The first thing I should point is that I'm obviously going to be biased towards the game, but I'll try to point out some of the flaws. Bearing in mind this is the first version of Early Access, so I bet in a few weeks this review will be entirely outdated.

Pros:
- Combat: Solid hack and slash combat. Each character has three unique skills as well as a general skills that are shared between the characters. Weiss for example, has a lunge attack, an AoE and a long range barrage attack. Special attacks use up segments of your special bar, which can be refilled by chainging combos on enemies. Enemies are reasonably varied and require different tactics, although once you've played through a few runs you begin to determine the best ways to beat them, so it's a case of memorisation e.g. Beowolves can be killed with a single combo, Ursas take multiple and you should avoid their ground pound etc.

- Upgrade trees: Characters can level up their skills over the course of a campaign. You get 9 points (assuming you reach level 10) to invest however you want, and at the end of the campaign your character is reset. This MOBA style leveling allows you to play different roles each time. Using our Weiss example, one playthrough I might max out her Nova AoE attack, allowing me to freeze enemies and control the crowd. Another run I might max her lunge, letting me quickly dispatch high health enemies. Challenges that let you unlock special skills are persistant though, so once you unlock them you never have to again. This rewards people that play the game with special upgrades as time goes by.

-Voice acting: Since the game is made by Roosterteeth, all the characters have the same voice actors as the show, which really puts you in the world. Ruby and Yang especially make you feel like you're taking part in an episode.

Character variation: Each character has a distinct style of combat, so it's really refreshing to switch between them. Yang is very much an in your face brawler, Blake excels at moving around the battlefield picking off targets quickly, Weiss can provide incredibly useful support in the form of freezing, Ruby has superb long range attacks and varied skills for any situation. Additionally, the unique passive skills you can unlock feel perfectly suited for each character, tied to their history and styles.

Cons:
- Bugs: To be expected for Early Access, but surprisingly minor bugs so far. Characters suck at going down slopes, their animations freeze or stutter until they get onto level ground. If using a controller, moving at low speeds causes your character to glide. Blake has a weird period of glide if you move immediately after firing her gun. Ruby's ranged attack propels her backwards, so sustained firing can cause you to sort of merge into walls, although I've not gotten stuck from this yet. However, the combat is absolutely solid. I've heard that two characters that are downed next to each other can revive each other but I've not experienced this myself.

-Jumping: To be honest, the jumping feels kind of pointless so far. Most enemies are low enough to the ground that jump attacks just miss, and the ones that you can hit (like Ursa) you're better off getting a ground combo off for full damage.

-Short: While the character leveling and variation lends itself nicely to multiple playthroughs, at the moment there's only one campaign, spanning four 'stages'. It can quickly get repetitive, but there are a planned 3 total campaigns. That's probably around 3-4 hours content if you play multiplayer, more in singleplayer. But, the real appeal is in the character development so this should balance out fine.

Overall, if you're a fan of Roosterteeth, RWBY or solid hack and slash games I highly recommend Grimm Eclipse. It's a small team of 4 developers, but since they're not on a schedule and this is basically a side project for RT they can take their time and make exactly the game they want to make. Very fun, High replayability, Great matchmaking/co-op and less buggy than Assassins Creed.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAs a long-time fan of Hack 'n Slash games and anime, I had to pick this game up. I was not disappointed at all. Despite the lack of campaign levels and play options, the game is absolutely addicting. This game has an amazing concept going and, if they do it right, Rooster Teeth could take this game to new heights in the realm of Hack 'n Slash. This game has infinite potential to become an amazing game and I expect great things out of it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, sorry for my English. It isn't my native language and I'm pretty bad with it.

Such a nice game we have there, Rooster Teeth we love you!

Let's talk about its Pros and Cons.

Pros:+ Nice setting. I really like this anime style.
+ Hack and slash.
+ Really fun to play.
+ RWBY team.
+ Team combos.
+ Weiss is really COOL.
+ 1 player offline mode (no team combos, duh).
+ Weiss is so COOL that freezed enemies can't help touching her (using claws)
+ You can jump, jump, jump... and SUDDENLY you're looking at everyone like they are all miserables. mwahahahaha!
+ Counters are not so broken now.

Cons (these are no match to Pros, though):- Only RWBY team (add JNPR at least, please).
- Some performance issues (no big deal, this is Early Access and RTG working on it).
- No PvP. I really want this game to have PvP mode someday.
- Only 10 points to distribute, I mean, really only 10 of them? Awww...

This game is certainly must-pick for any RWBY fan, but I would reccommend this game to everyone because there's really many interesting things in it.

Aerith bless you all!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day 1 Early Access review of 45 mins of gamplay playing as Ruby.

The game is very solid gameplay wise. Fighting is very fluid and enjoyable. So far i havn't encountered any bugs and the Grimm seem both easy to deal with alone, but watch out if you are seperated from your team and surrounded by them.

So far the only issues i have with the game are minor. Ruby could use a targeting crosshair or aiming assist for her Right-Click shoot as i could never tell where i was aiming. Settings of course could be expanded. The fighting and Grimm sounds are LOUD AS ALL CAN GET and nearly blasted my ears off without the setting to change the sound for it. A tutorial would be nice to assist with learning the abilities, but after just playing around for 5-10 mins I got the gist of how the abilities worked.  The only Bug i have encountered so far is Ruby's animation freezes when walking down a slope/hill, instead of showing the walking animiation but its not too big a deal.

Another little thing that bugs me is how out of place the characters look in the world. In the underground city section of the emerald forest, Ruby's model was bright and stuck out compared to the underground tunnel she was in, and she had no shadow.

Since this is early access i understand the game is still very early in development. Like others i would love to see player progression and customization in the future. I had 2 Blakes in my game and the only way to tell them apart was to walk up to them to see their names.

Other than these little things i mentioned, I so far enjoy the game a bunch and i'm about to go hop into a game with some friends now to play.

8/10 overall.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is good IMO, not without flaws though. Most of this review is pretty much my opinion. but I mean hey I do enjoy the game.

-pros
The game environment is well drawn
The characters have unique dialogue and skill sets
Character design is pretty good
Multiplayer function is a big + for me

-Cons
The movement needs work, characters float from time to time.
Blake move set/skill are probably the worst. I feel no reason to play her other then liking her as a character
Blake's hit boxes are also bad
Way to short even for early access. 3 hours and Ive beat it all using characters. That includes soloing on play through

Review: Other then some pretty big fault in character skill and hit boxing I enjoyed it. I would recommend if you have the money to spare and you don't mind the repetition. I feel like the environment fits the lore well and it is fun to explore outside of what we see in the show. With there was more game play then gauntlet fights that pretty much wrap up all but one of the levels.

Characters are pretty fun to play as, I had a lot of fun messing around with Ruby and Weiss. Yang took a bit to get used to, I could see her being hard to play if you dont get the special that helps restore special skill. The scoring is heavily dominated by decent AoE attacks so Blake and Yang suffer a lot from that from not having good ones. Blake by far is the worst character in the game and has majority of the flaw/bugs character wise. Her moves are pretty bad, they either dont do like any damage compared to the others or sometimes are just useless. He shadow clone ability I think is really cool, however it take 1 special to use and is only good if you chain it with other clones. Her gun pretty much misses 70% of the time. I literally stood in front of a box and missed. Yangs problems I think is in her DPS. I think she should be a harder hitting character, maybe not a huge difference but I think she should do a bit more. Ruby and Weiss don't need much improvement, I think they are easily the most OP characters with their god like AoEs and specials.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a fun and beautiful game that fans of RWBY like myself will enjoy to play, but since this is a Early Access Game there  are some things that need to be improve and so things I would like to see added.

Things that I like to see impove on:
1. The running animation because I have seen the girls stop in mid running motion but still be moving.
2. The audio adjustments because I would like to hear the girls and NPCs talk oven the sound effects of the fights.
3. More back gound music for the levels because sometimes as I play I hear nothing.
4. Sounds for the Grimms.

Things I would to see added:
1. More characters
2. A Camera Reset Button so when the Grimm goes off screen you can quickly move the camera behine you huntress.
3. Team attack Combos like if there is a Ruby and a Weiss with full special gage and they are near each other and both players hit a set button combo like one person hits Q and the other hits E then Ruby and Weiss pulls off Ice flower.
4. A Target System so you can concentrate the big Grimms the may need more time to attack.
5. A keyboard/controller button map because even thought the controls are easy to lean I still think it be nice to see or even change the buttoun options.

As you can see these are just a few things that I would like to see happen in later updates but as of right now it's still a fun game to play and I can't wait to see it as it grows into the game that we Rwby fans think it can become.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAfter playing this for awhile, I realize that the game does have it's flaws in it's current state. Many. Just to address that a offline single-player mode should be added in later development since online only is just a little off-putting. Second: A save feature should added later since upgrading skills and leveling up seeming pointless at the moment since every time you play a game you reset back to lvl 1. The audio is great but audio in sounds really drone out the music even when music volume is maxed out sometimes so audio levels need to be adjusted later in development. Comabt is very fun but the special moves need some work more so on how to increase your special meter, personally i think a cooldown meter would be a lot better because it is so irritating that one hit breaks your combo meter espically when you need 12 hits to increase it by one block, hitboxes are another problem too since sometimes it feels and looks as close-range enemy attacks seem to hit me farther than usual which go in into the same issue with the special moves. Lastly some attack animations are missing from enemies, very very noticable when they are attacking the control center in those protect the control tower" parts where you can clearly see them just standing in front of it while the area's health lowers. In conclusion this game still needs alot of work and improvements but this is why it's in early access state of development
date: the game is fantastic and loads of fun with other people but i'd say to wait maybe just a little longer to purchase since it still needs some improvement cause this has alot of potential. I still recommend it to RWBY fans and hack-and-slash fans
recommended: just don't expect perfection since this just released and is in early access"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It took me a bit to decide if I really liked this game. I'm a big fan of RWBY and Rooster Teeth, so I didn't want my bias to get in the way. But after playing as all four characters and experiencing the game with lots of diffferent groups, I can say its pretty fun.

The controls are tight and feel good, and although there's no tutourial (which I hope the main game will have) it doesn't take long to pick up on things. I noticed a difference in the characters with how hard they hit and how fast they moved, though it could have been my considerably defensive playstyle. The levels look beautiful, and I'd love to explore them more, but besides the occassional branching path there isn't much deviation. The game sounds good, from the music to the voices, but sound effects (especially leveling up and health regen) need to be reduced, or at least have a slider.

My biggest complaint is probably the initial interfacing. If you play with randoms, you can't tell who the other characters are, which sucks if you want to go with the full Team RWBY setup and end up with Team RRWY.  I was initially a bit upset that you had to start from the begining unle,ss you joined a friend, butr considering how short a full playthrough is (about an hour) it's not a big deal. I just hope the final version has a level select and slightly better single-player setup.

This game is short, but a lot of fun. You can tell by the way it ends that they're setting uup for the full release, which is fine by me. I hope the cutscenes are animated like the World of Remnant" shorts
date: and they do even more voice acting. The $15 feels a bit pricey for a game that is clearly more akin to a demo
recommended: but it's early access and from Rooster Teeth
hoursPlayed: so I trust this will be more than worth it in the future."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dislcaimer - I'm a RWBY fanboy so this will be quite biased (I want to like this game). I also am a game dev myself so yeah there actually will be critisism in here. I have a reputation to uphold" - Weiss Schnee

As it is early acess you should be expecting bugs. So if you want a PERFECT game turn away now. It's bound to get better in the next 8-10 months though (at least i hope so).

So lets get into it -
Pros:
- Doesn't take up much space on your computer (small file)
- Maps are beautiful
- The characters (team RWBY) so far look great
- Controls are good
- Fast paced gameplay
- Easy to chain combos together
- The health - contrary to what most people are saying
date:
i think the health is a good idea.  Getting youself surrounded in this game gets you killed just as quickly as it would in the show. If you're a casual player... yeah go play something else. This game isn't even that hard.
- OMG THE VOICE ACTING
- AND THAT SOUND TRACK (I'm a sucker for a good sound track)

Cons:
- If you don't watch the show this is quite literally going to be a waste of your time and money.
- When you are walking up or down hills the walking/running animation is frozen (you look like you stop moving and glide across the map)
- The targeting system doesn't always work with you. You'll find yourself shooting at the wrong target and missing straight line skill shots.
- Oh yeah
recommended:
it's really repetitive.
- Invisible walls... like lots of them.
- Almost no customization. It'd be cool if there was a basic character and weapon creator as a feature but that'd probably create more than a few bugs in and of itself. It gets to me because I love OC's (original characters) in games like this one. The closest thing to customization in this game is the skill tree (which gets wiped clean everytime you start a new game).
- All the characters pretty much feel the same. Melee

Kill.

Conclusion:
At the end of the day this game is faithful to the show and in my opinon has quite a few bugs. I DO NOT REGRET MY PURCHASE. I have faith that the game will improve quite a lot in the coming months and even if you aren't a die hard fan I'd recommend picking up this game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like this game so far and I can't wait to see what it will truly become! I do understand that this game is still in early access, but here are are few things I would like to point out to the developers.

1. For me at least, I have noticed the game crashing after finishing the mission in Mountain Glenn after the tall building falls down. At this point I'm directed to a frozen screen where I'm meant to transfer to Mountain Glenn Underground. This is where the game crashes for me.
2. I am getting vibes from Dynasty Warriors on this game, as far as the playstyle is concerned, but, like the more recent rwby episodes, the fighting seems too rushed, and I feel disconnected from the character at such a distance away. If we could integrate heavy and light attacks at a slower and more believable pace, we could discover some really cool combos as well as some hybrid ones with the firearms, and people would be able to see cleary how their button presses effect the characters fighting. And yes, there should be a blocking mechanism.
3. Majority of my reasoning is not just my own, as I believe many have already pointed these things out. One last thing I wanna ask the developers is if they have seen the AllTheoryNoPractice channel on Youtube where there is a RWBY Design video. This guy was at RTX when Rooster Teeth announced that they were becoming a game studio, and so had 10-ish" hours worth of design that went through his head for the game as he saw it.  The way he envisioned the RWBY game is much different to the way the game is given currently
date: but I won't give all the details since his video explains it all much better than I would.\n4. Lastly

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Its thus far a very wonderful game. Its artstyle is very very close to what you see in the show and it gives to its players a sense that they are playing RWBY. The action is very swift and fast paced, small skill trees that makes you feel like your almost playing a moba, and a small set of combo attacks. Its not combo heavy but it is certainly a hack'n slash at its core.

Thus far its only 3 days after its early access so it only really has one campaign so far that takes between 30 minutes to an hour to complete. I wouldnt critisize this too much cause its got 4 distinct area's to it with mobs that act like they do in the show. The more players you have the harder the fight gets up to 4 players.

Last note I shall shine on is the characters. when playing each character you feel like you are them from the show. it is very well thought up and the combat style, even though there are small area's of improvement I see, are spot on.

I can easily see this game be a smash hit if the developer gives it just the right amount of elbow grease. Tons of action, lots of potential gameplay, and a limitless possability in campaigns and missions. If the skill system is panned out just a tiny bit and maybe broadened. I would say this game is going places.

On a side note. I would like to state that it would be awesome to see a wavebased survival mode. This is exactly the type of game that would well support that and would broaden the game in general. I love wave based survival and RWBY I could easily see make it happen in a wonderful way.

If your an RWBY fan, get the game d (^.^) d

reviewText:
Early Access Review

tl;dr - Game shows potential, remembering that early access games aren't complete is important. Fun beatem up style, even for non-RWBY fans.

Alright everybody, I'd like to preface this by saying I am in no way someone who reviews games on the regular. I probably don't know what I am talking about, but this is my opinion of the GAME (Not as part of RWBY).

The feel of the gameplay mechanics seem very Dyntasty Warriors in my optinon. It's a beatem up game in which they throw many weaker enemies at you. Its fun to kill massive amounts of these creatures. Dispite being simplistic, the controls still allow for a good amout of diversity with the combos that you can preform. Most importantly is the 3 main abilities which are unique for the four characters. They all feel effective and worth using, although I have personally run into issues of larger creatures blocking the damage from them by attacking. Either way, people find what playstyle they want to go for, the abilities and level ups give you the option to focus more on a specific style of play. Contrary to popular beleif, your progress does save, your level does not. So when an unlock requires you to kill x amount of grimm, once you unlock that you don't have to re-unlock it later. As far a gameplay is concerned there are some issues that appear (Glitching and whatnot). However we have to remember that this is an EARLY ACCESS game. Meaning this review is based on this games potential.

Graphically this game is beautiful, and dispite having many many invisible walls  you still feel as if you can roam around a little. I noticed some complaints about how the main characters looked. That they seemed flat, specifically in their hair. to me, thats the style they were going for. The sound effects need some toning down, as they are super loud, but that's an easy fix I would think. Of course the voice acting is good, although characterized.

All in all i would recomend this game, I think it will be improved on by the developers as I have never known RoosterTeeth to slack off in anything they do. Give it a little more time and this'll be a very fun beatem up game to play with friends.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR - Play the game, it's a very early access but it's alot of fun and if you're into RWBY like myself then you don't want to miss following it's development.

I'd like to point out first that i'm a huge fan of the RWBY franchise and in my attempt to make a review I will try to stay as unbiased as possible. I don't feel like I need to point out the different story related elements since most of your already know them and the rest will have read it someplace else.

As an early access it was pretty obvious to me even before I started that the game would contain lots of bugs and little content, but despite knowing this I still wanted to dive into the RWBY universe and feel the rush of controlling one of the four protagonists from team RWBY.

My personal experience from playing this game is very positive, the controls required some getting used to but was very smooth. The battle animations was smooth aswell but certain enemies could sometimes lag in their attacks and mess up your dodge timing, but I endured it since it's just an early access. Obviously most of those issues will be dealt with as bug/glitch fixes and polishing.

The sound was alright quality wise but the sound levels was abit all over the place, loud combat sounds and low voices made it feel abit frustrating at time (I ended up lowering them alltogether and pull out my RWBY vol.1-2 soundtracks).

Graphics is really nice in a charming way, it's nothing fascinating like the big titles of 2015 but it serves its purpose of staying true to the RWBY universe. It's my personal hope that they do not change the style and direction they are going for, I just wish they would add alittle bit more of what already is there to the world and give it some more depth".

When this review was made there was only one "Chapter" I suppose you could call it
date: called Emerald Forest and it had alot of areas for casual battles and a bunch of defense locations
recommended: a boss room and a escort mission. So there is/was quite alot of things to do. Only thing most people complained about here was that your leveling progress was resetted between each new run
hoursPlayed: only thing that was consistant was the progress of unlocking new ability upgrades. Hopefully they will look into this more ahead or perhaps they already plan to make changes to that.\n\nThere was some minor bugs that me and my friend personally found but nothing that halted the games progress so far
voteText: game has alot of work and polishing to do but all in all it was very fun and I could tell it would be one of those games that brings out an addiction in people once it's completed.\n\nNow for some biased stuff

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It is early access, so I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt in that it will become a good game.

If you're a fan of RWBY and want to support Rooster Teeth by throwing money at them or through testing, then take a stab at it.

If you're not all that much of a fan, but do enjoy the series, I would recommend waiting a few months. The animation, combat, and story are non-existant for the time being. There is enough there to be a decent hack-n-slash game, but nothing more. At this moment, it is not worth $15, but give it a few months and it might be up to snuff.
voteText: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before everyone starts complaining: I love this game.

RWBY has been one of my favorite series for a while now, and having a game of it is an amazing thing of it's own. I just simply think that in it's current state, it's NOT worth the 15 euros charged. However, when more content is added, i'm sure that my review will be altered to a recommended game.

RWBY: Grimm Eclipse is an amazing beat 'em up game, in which you have more then enough Grimm's to destroy. Cluster them up, use a special, see stuff die. It's amazing! The game currently consists of about 2 chapters, which have between 2 - 3 levels. Sadly, the game is currently completable in around an hour, probably shorter if you wish to speedrun it. I just simply cannot give it a recommendation at the moment, with the little amount of content it currently has. However, the amount of content that IS there, is a lot of fun. It's easy, beat ship up, but along the way there are recognizable characters talking and your teammates have fun little dialogue from time to time, in real RWBY fashion.

Give the game some time, and hopefully there wil be some more content soon. When there is, this game will definitely get a recommended from me. It's a must have for every RWBY fan. Do I recommend the game to RWBY fans in it's current state? No. The game is too incomplete. Wait a little longer, then it WILL be a good purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In its current form RWBY: GE has the framework for an action packed hack/slash 4 player co-op game. That being said though, the campaign currently out is way too short for me to recommend for the price. Maybe at 10 dollars until more stuff is added in. I know that 15 dollars (14.99) doesn't seem like much to Rooster Teeth but honestly I feel a tad cheated. There is only 1 game mode (that's ok) and it is the story mode I assume, however the issue of pricing became a concern when I found that the story mode has 5(Maybe more or less? I played 3 complete sets with 3 different groups and it kind of blurred) linear maps with holdout missions and nothing else. Experience points from crates are fought over (Why not share with the team? This is a cooperative game after all and artifacts count towards everyone already.) My biggest gripe would be the General Abilities which are unlocked by performing certain skills to kill enemies, reviving team-mates etc. In what universe are any of the player characters reasonably going to reach 200 kills using 1 of their abilities just to unlock a general ability like mastery? Some of the skills need work as well. I found myself only using 1 ability mostly because there is only about 1 per character worth investing in with the exception of Weiss who has a heal.
A good temporary fix for the game in its current state would be to have more Grimms per map and more waves of enemies during holdouts. This would help players get exp and pad out the gameplay because as it stands the game can be done in 30-45 minutes or so (feels like so much less)
Love the show
Stoked about the game but I can't recommend right now
Might change when new stuff is added or things change

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Flawed but fun
RWBY is a well knows and well respected franchise (aside from its hit or miss art style) and has grown quite a following over these past few years and the game seemed prime for a video game adaptation, what I was not expecting was a dynasty warriors and left for dead love child with 4 player co-op and a call new story

If you like the series you are more than likley going to like the game, there is plenty of fan fare that is in this so there is alot to see and enjoy, characters and art style is kept generally in tact and transfered stright over from the show pretty well.

The gameplay seemes that it takes most of its inspiration from the Dynasty Warriors games which generally has simple combos while destoying dozens of enemys very easily, enemies are tougher than in dynasty warriors but are still easy to take down with the right team, so bring friends and have fun.

But you must keep in mind this is still a early accsses game the only thing that i have really noticed up to this point is some audio issues, weirdly placed invisible walls and animation mess ups with the of course lack in content at this moment as well as some balencing issues with some specials seeming utterly pointless (like weiss' ranged attacks) while some things (like yangs shotgun gauntlents) feel overpowered.

If I could give any recomendations to the developers its to:
Add more playable characters (perhaps team JNPR)
Add more and generally better songs
More balencing between characters
Fixes buggs and such
More enviroments
Team chat

Overall RWBY: Grimm Eclipse is a good start and a great time with 3 friends to what I hope will become a great game that will be more fleshed out and overall a great addition to a already great series :)

Early Acsess score: 7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even as a massive RWBY fan I cannot, in good faith, recommend you buy this game. At least, not yet. There currently doesn't appear to be a way to customize the controls. Nor is there a way to even look at them until you're actually in the game, as that option is only available in-game and not from the main menu. Nor is there a training or practice mode of any sort.

Soooo basically you hop into a match, forcing up to three other people to carry your useless butt while you frantically look up the controls and hope to god your controller works with the game without any tweaking (mine didn't except for the left analog stick - yay!). Because if it doesn't, you are screwed. Or you can play an action game on the keyboard. Yay (</sarcasm>)

This game might be awesome in a few months, after some more development, but right now I suggest you stay far, far away.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I got to play the beta of this at RTX 2015 and even got to play the original version before Rooster Teeth had decided to take it on board.

And let me tell you, this game has come a long, long way.

There are some small glitches in the walking animation sometimes, and the lack of a targetting button makes it a little difficult to keep track of who you are fighting. But those are my biggest issues. Which is, honestly, not much of an issue. These things will most likely be fixed in the days to come. But over all this game is a lot of fun. Beating down on the Grimm is satysfying, the characters all have their voices, each one plays very differently from the others, the environments are beautiful, and the combat is fantastic.

If you like the series, definitely worth picking up

If you don't know RWBY, I'd suggest watching the series and see if you enjoy it before getting in this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*UPDATED 12/6 8:57 PM PACIFIC TIME*

*UPDATE* This game is starting to get pretty fun the more I play it.

I'll tell you this now. I am a huge fan of RWBY, probably one of the biggest, but this game in all honestly is really underwhelming. I know this game is still in early access, and I know the game will definitely improve over the next couple updates and become an amazing game, but for now, it's really bad. This game as of now is not worth 15 dollars, so don't buy it unless you're a diehard RWBY fan such as myself.

I'll start with the cons first of this game.

Cons:
-The Animations for this game is very choppy. When I see the characters walk, I sorta cringe a little because of how bad it was.
-This game gets VERYYYYYY laggy at times. When you hit big waves, which you're going to often encounter, the game can't handle all the mobs and gets super laggy.
-Your character progress does not save once you exit the game. This is very frustrating at times because I would get my character to a pretty high level and it doesn't even save.
-Very Limited move pool. I know this is going to expand further as the game updates and such, but each character only has 3 special moves and then the normal slash combo. Pretty underwhelming because if you compare it to other Dynasty warrior ripoff games, they have this aspect correct.
-Subtitles are pretty bad/can't keep up if they speak very long sentences.


Now onto the Pros:

Pros:
-It's a ♥♥♥♥ing RWBY game. I've been waiting for this for so long. Once I heard it was on Steam greenlight, I immediately upvoted it because more RWBY stuff = More RWBY love and popularity.
-Voice Acting is very good. They got the Voice Actors for each of the RWBY characters in this game and it's really awesome hearing them speak in the game.
-Besides Limited move pool, the combat is really fun at times. I'm sure they're going to eventually add more moves and newer enemies in the game, and that'd be super awesome.
-Character designs are awesome. Besides the choppy animation, them character designs are to die for.
-It's a New story, new enemies we've never encountered, it's pretty awesome if you want to see that.
-The ♥♥♥♥ing music is beautiful. let me spell it out for you. B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L.

I love the RWBY series, I love everything about it. From the characters to the music to its lore. But my god this game is so not worth 15 dollars. Unless you're a die hard RWBY fan or a person who likes playing Early Access games. Don't buy this game for 15 dollars. This is at best a 5-10 dollar game, but not a 15.

*UPDATE*
What I want to see more with the game:
-It'd be awesome if we get some sort of PVP system going in the game, just like the battle colosseum in Volume 3 of RWBY.
-A custom character creation. It'd be really awesome if we can create our own character and play them in campaign missions.
-A firefight game mode. Just pure waves of grimm until you all die.
-Unlockable characters such as Cinder and Neo. I so want to play that adorable small ice cream lady.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before anything else, this is not a bad game. It has potential to be something great.  It's just too rough around the edges as it currently stands and needs a lot of fixing and polish.

...And the removal of those boars. Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ those guys.

Pros:

x The combat is responsive and it's fun to play.

x Stays true to the series. Ruby is very childish, Weiss is a whiney smart ♥♥♥, i don't think i even heard Blake talk even with my friend playing her the whole time. And Yang? Well, Yang is Yang.

x It's very pretty and enjoyable to look at. While it's obviously not graphically stunning like say Battlefront. It looks like the show, colorful and lively.

Cons:

x Randomly kicks me to the main menu in the middle of a game. I don't know what causes this, but quite obviously it needs to be fixed.

x Random disconnections: This is a similar problem to the one above, but instead of kicking you back to the main menu it just leaves you in game and nothing moves but you.

x (Fixed) The movement animations: Running up hills and stairs is very janky and causes your character to bounce up and down a little bit. Running down hills and stairs is you just floating down with your legs in a running position, not moving until you hit a flat surface.

x (Fixed?? I don't know if this was really considered a problem, but they replaced the audio for it.) The aura regen sounds like it was ripped from Halo. While this is not really a problem, it doesn't sound like it belongs there.

x Lack of enemy variety. I think we literally fought 5 enemy types and for the most part they attacked very similarly. (Also, ♥♥♥♥ those boars)

x (Blake only) If you try to run immediately after shooting, Blake will do a standing slide for about half a second.


I will periodically play and update this review. I will mentioned what is fixed and anything new i find.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just got into this game. So far, I enjoy it.

+Graphics are great. It feels immersive when I run through the stage.
+Fighting mechanics are great so far. I didn't notice any gameplay bugs or problems while I am fighting an enemy.
+Music is enjoyable. It's captures the music of the RWBY show itself.
+Ability and level-up features are great.

However, I do notice some parts of the game that need improvement:

-The camera angling needs work. I find myself adjusting the camera so that I am able to see the enemy I'm fighting directly.
-A dash mechanic would be nice. It kind of feels dragged out when I'm taking some time trying to get from one place to another.
-It's a small thing, but it would be cool if the radar on the top left shows the terrain.
-Some graphical dynamics would help give the game more oomph" when you are using a special attack or a crazy combo.
-A manual lock-on feature would help me shoot the correct enemy from afar.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR at bottom


Alright, so this game is in early access.  Which means, it will be expanded upon.  Which means that it has an excuse for being short.  That said, what is already in the game, for the most part, is great.  The look of the game is great, as are the sounds.  Combat is good for the most part but things could be improved.

Also, when reading the list below, keep in mind I have 9hrs, with a lot of it pretty much all playing on Blake, so there will be a number of points focused around her..

The Good Stuff:-Graphic style
-Smooth combat ( dodges, attack notifications)
-Good 'ol music
-Voice acting (mostly)
-Easy to play with friends
-Not restrictive on who you can play
-Enemy variations
-Character models are brilliant!
-Active dev team

The Stuff-which-could-be-improved:-More content (again, EA so it's okay for now)
-Bugs (EA, again, it's okay for now)
-Blake's VA gone missing! (But seriously, I wish for Arryn's voice on Blake; which I assume will be coming)
-Invisible walls make movement a bit clunky between fights
-Blake's attacks often leave her in the air, missing the all the mobs below (esp. annoying on Alpha Beo's)
-Lack of some variey between characters (As I ahve palyed more of each character, there are definite differences between them.  But from the start, they still feel sorta similar.  I think more creativity with the skills could draw out more variety)
-Lack of move combos (I felt as if there was more in the Alpha, which is a bit strange...)
-Subtitles (a bit too much in each display on the screen, some text is lost offscreen, inaccurate at times)
-Aiming (ranged abilites are very hard to make hit what you want them to)
-Late animation transitions (animations take a split second change, i.e. running to standing - Still running in place for a moment.)

Summary     Now this seems like a lot of negative stuff and little good stuff.  Something to keep in mind is that this is the first game RT has made, it hasn't even been out for a week, it's Early Access, and they've already put out a day #3 patch.  Also, it's way easier to complain than compliment anyhting in life.  So, I look forward to how this game develops, can't WAIT for more content (as far as campaign and progression go, and would highly recommend getting this game.  A lot of the negative points are, in reality (or rather gameplay), small things that largely go unnoticed.

See y'all in Remnant!


TL;DRShort game with a fair amount of unobtrusive bugs.  Captures the feel of RWBY damn near perfectly.  Team has already shown development on the game (post-launch, of course).  Plays well.  Buy it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, here we go. This game is still in its early stages, so naturally, it's going to have flaws. But, despite being in early alpha, it has already managed to impress me. So, let's go through what this game does well, first.

RWBY: Grimm Eclipse does a fantastic job of making it feel like you're 'playing the show'. The animation is great, and every once and a while you get a little quote from one of the characters, which, just like the show itself, is fantastically voice acted. The graphics are great, and the game holds up well enough performance-wise.

Perhaps the thing that was focused on the most in the development of this early access game was the combat. Fighting in this game is so satisfying, especially when you land a huge hit on an enemy and they go flying back, melting away slowly. The attacks and fighting styles are fluent and beautiful, and it just feels right when you hit something. The four playable characters each have three special attacks that, through leveling up, increase in power. Every character has a fairly in-depth skill tree that you can put points into, to make your character more powerful. Keep in mind that this game features  MOBA-style leveling, so each time you play, you will be set back to level one. This may sound like a drag, but it is a very good concept. When you start a game with friends, you can place your points according to how you want to either support your team, or just be a full blown killing machine.

As far as story goes, there really isn't much in the realm of story as much as there is just slaying hordes of monsters, with an objective here and there. So far, there are only four stages, which can all be completed in a matter of 45 minutes. Obviously there are more to come, but at the moment, we have only four stages. Surprisingly, playing these levels over again does not get boring. With the ability to make a different character build every game, the seemingly repititive gameplay continues to be exciting and fun.

As stated earlier, of course this game is going to have flaws. There are a few, not many, but only two stand out to me.

Firstly, I found that the four playable characters are very unbalanced. Yang and Weiss are fairly versitile, but it seems like Ruby is too overpowered, and Blake is too underpowered. I've played as both of them, and playing as Ruby was so easy, while playing as Blake put me through the ringer. Some more balance would be nice.

Lastly, the lack of a main story makes it very difficult for someone with a limited knowledge of RWBY to know what's going on, or know who anyone is. There really isn't much more to say. Hopefully the full game will have a cutscene at the beginning or something like that to introduce tha characters, and the plot.

Overall, so far this game is well done. There's still plenty more updates to come, though. Perhaps we'll get new characters, new abilities, the possibilities are endless. This game is an easy buy for big RWBY fans, but for others who are either new to the series or never heard of it, I'd wait for the full game to be released.

Overall Rating: 6.5-7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

so, first impressions after playing an hour: for an early access game, this seems pretty polished! everything ran smoothly, no lag, even when someone would jump in/out of the game! graphics are great like the show, soundtrack makes great use of the show's background soundtracks (could've used maybe 1-2 instances of some of the sung songs?). voice acting is decent, few lines got a bit repetitive (looking at you yang) but overall on par with the show. gameplay is where things start to get a little...eh, with room for improvement. right now, all 4 characters are very similar in how they play; same combos, same sort of attacks, but they do have some difference to them. Ruby's attacks hit very wide, weiss feels very sharp and precise, blake has a sort of jumpey floaty feel to her, and yang feels heavy and weighty with her attacks. personally, i think as the level caps grow, more skills could be added that would defferentiate them better.
overall, this is a pretty solid core game, and the only thing really lacking right now is content. more campaign chapters, characters, and skills would bring this game up. one thing i did find odd to be missing is any kind of tutorial though. nothing about control mapping, or explenation of the controls. that being said, they are pretty basic, so a few minutes of button mashing and you'll figure it out! for now, i'd reccomend this game to fans of the show who wanna support it's continued development. for 17$ CDN, i feel this was a worthwhile purchase

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I first learned of this game by ad in the RWBY TV series. The game is really fun and I spent hours getting all characters maxed out on their upgrades and tried each one to the fullest. My first impression for this beta version is well positive with a few things I do not like.

Pros;
Each character has their own uniqe feel. Each one is good at certain points and certain monsters.
The game is really fast and the keys are well timed,( have a high end computer)
The graphics remain similar to that of the show and the characters have the same persanalities.
The skill tree for each one is simple to use and to focus on specializing in different fighting tactics.
Landscape is well laid out and there are few locations that sends you down a different path different play throughs.
Easily replayable even if you mastered all characters.
Can start a new game or jump into one already in progress.

Cons;
Several players drops out a lot which causes slight caos till the difficulty is reset.
A few small glitches and graphic bugs.
Very straight foward and rare environment interactions.
Only 4 characters.
Very simple option menu no customizing hardly.
Only 1 chapter at this point.
No training season. Just throws you right into the fight.
Story is somewhat flat at the moment with just a few talking here and there.
When the host computer losses connection it sends the other players back a ways sometimes all the way back to the beggining.

What I wish to see them add;
Boxes also randomly drop special refill orbs similar to the XP orbs.
Have more playable characters be able to unlock and played from the show.
More environment interaction
Able to have higher lvl attainment
More skills for each characters.
Have a key that brings up a quick order comand, ex; Help, Form up, Wait and so on so we do not have to chat it.
New game menu have a toggle for random characters you have and a toggle for no repeat of characters. This way you form a team and not have 2-4 of the same character.
A training chapter so new and old players can train and practice the different characters.
Would love to see more of the songs from the show added into comabt and more frequent.
Different game modes; teams, solo, time trial, competitions
Like to see an arena style game mode that lets players fight other players.
A way to invite frinds to your new game start up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When it comes to anything about RWBY, I'm something of a zealot: music, pictures, the show, and now the game. I absolutely LOVE RWBY, and thankfully RWBY: Grimm Eclipse does not disappoint in the slightest.

It's a really good action-adventure hack-n-slash with pretty good mechanics, fun dialogue/SFX/audio, and lots of over the top action that we're all used to from the show. I'm so hyped for when they add more characters (here's hoping that team STRQ gets added at some point). I'll admit, the game feels a tad basic at times, but it's still early access, so I'm not worried. Even if it weren't, it'd still be a really, REALLY good game.

All I can say is that this is a 10/10 game, unless you're a RWBY fan, which makes it an 11/10. Highly recommend getting it first chance you get!

Rest in peace, Monty: your work - and now legacy - continues to inspire and entertain countless lives. The world is a smaller place without you.

Never stop moving forward.""

But also if you love hack and slash games, with this game being a early access game I can see great potential in new combos, more characters like Sun would love playing as him. They could also include a versus mode in the form of the tournament for arena and so much more, special combo attacks between characters and more... so much more room to grow XD

This game is awesome and will keep getting better.

I find mainly 3 problems at the moment that bother me, 1st when you character throws an enemy in the air to keep an aerial combo the enemy wont leave the ground so you end up comboing the air. 2nd the lack of a center camera button (since I like playing games like this with controller) and last but not least the lack of the epic soundtrack we know and love for. Would also like more dialogues between characters as they seem to talk alone a lot, like one liners. Also there should be an option that doesnt allow a player to pick another character already in use, I mean seeing to Rubys for example is kinda weird.

Well thats all I got to say, great game, great potential, few cons. Like Ruby would say: This is AWESOME!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

so, first impressions after playing an hour: for an early access game, this seems pretty polished! everything ran smoothly, no lag, even when someone would jump in/out of the game! graphics are great like the show, soundtrack makes great use of the show's background soundtracks (could've used maybe 1-2 instances of some of the sung songs?). voice acting is decent, few lines got a bit repetitive (looking at you yang) but overall on par with the show. gameplay is where things start to get a little...eh, with room for improvement. right now, all 4 characters are very similar in how they play; same combos, same sort of attacks, but they do have some difference to them. Ruby's attacks hit very wide, weiss feels very sharp and precise, blake has a sort of jumpey floaty feel to her, and yang feels heavy and weighty with her attacks. personally, i think as the level caps grow, more skills could be added that would defferentiate them better.
overall, this is a pretty solid core game, and the only thing really lacking right now is content. more campaign chapters, characters, and skills would bring this game up. one thing i did find odd to be missing is any kind of tutorial though. nothing about control mapping, or explenation of the controls. that being said, they are pretty basic, so a few minutes of button mashing and you'll figure it out! for now, i'd reccomend this game to fans of the show who wanna support it's continued development. for 17$ CDN, i feel this was a worthwhile purchase

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW: So, other than optimization issues and bugs (which as anyone on Steam will say always come with early access games), the foundation Rooster Teeth is putting out right now is incredibly solid. Pretty much feels like a complete game so far, that just needs some more content in the long run.
The currently available gamemode is a nice mix of MOBA elements with the typical campaign/story mode system of levels with progressing difficulty, which (at least personally) I haven't really ever seen before in a multiplayer game.
That being said, I have do an issue with the design choice of allowing players to all pick the same character as each other in a game. Forcing players to each pick a different character and switch up their playstyle couldn't be that harsh of a restriction, and honestly could lead to more interesting sessions instead of four Ruby's with dust nukes.
However, if Rooster Teeth does decide to add more characters, I think it would be amazing to not restrict four player teams to only the four characters of a team. Allowing players to mix and match different characters from different teams would create some incredible synergy with all of the combinations people come up with. However, I imagine the work load would be a lot more than just restricting players to a single team for a session, because it would require literally balancing everyone with everyone.
Of course these ideas come from someone who has never actually made a videogame, and are really just things that one person would like to see come along in the game. I could also just be repeating what's already known, so yeah.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile still very early on in development the game has a lot of noticable flaws, but also a lot of noticable quirks that make it lovable, characters are pretty unbalanced as far as team RWBY goes, highly noticable but don't let that stop you from playing your favorite of the four. Overall it takes about 30-35 minutes to finish the first (and only) available campaign. All your favorite voice actresses from the show are present in the game as well as the few current male voices available. The sound quality is great and the music is really nice to listen to wether you're running through nature or taking it to the Grimm. This is definitely a game that is more fun with multiple people, at least two are recommended if you plan to run this, solo it gets stale pretty quickly and it's fun to see who can rack the highest score at the end of each stage. Overall right now I'd give the game an 8/10 due to the apparent problems which are still being worked on and patched as they make fixes. Is the game worth 14.99? Absolutely I'd say, I've found myself playing this time and time again with friends and strangers alike whenever I feel the need to let off some stress from work or just a bad day. Overall I say give this game a try if you're a fan of the show, just be ready to see some obvious flaws.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have owned this game for around a week now and have been playing it on and off as my laptop isn't quite strong enough to handle it. However, overall, I have enjoyed the combat, storyline and graphics, even when on 'potato'. Props to the development team at RT for creating such an awesome game!

Pros:
- Reasonably smooth animations
- Well rendered environments
- Good leveling system

Cons:
- Special bar takes FOREVER to regenerate
- Too many invisible walls, especially in the underground Mountain Glenn level
- Yang is too OP
- Auto-aiming system isn't very good
- Not properly optimised for weaker PCs yet

Even though there are more cons then pros at this point, I feel that this game has HUGE amounts of potential, and, although I wouldn't reccomend it for people who aren't fans of the original show, I would reccomend it for anyone that likes testing games out or for people who are massive fans of the show, like I am. Like I said, well done to the 4-man development team at RT for doing so well with this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For those who don't know much about the series, they might not understand a lot about what's going on as this takes place after season 2 and before season 3. I would probably recommend something in the option that can give the player a short re-cap of what happened between seasons 1 & 2, this can allow players who got this game without watching the series to get a basic summarization of what happened and possibly allow them to look into the series more themselves through the game.

Aside from that, really fun game with beautiful graphics. I've only played as Blake and Ruby right now but I personally like how each character's skills and playing style fits with how they are in the series. Using RPG class terms, Blake is similar to the Ninja that attacks quickly and is better at at a distance as well as reviving her team mates, while Yang is similar to a Monk class that just tanks and deals damage. Most of the errors in this game have already been mentioned, but my only thing that I'd recommend is check the audio files in the game before releasing updates. There was one point I saw Yang's picture but heard Ruby's voice, and Ruby wasn't even around. So mistakes like that do need to be corrected as it is something that does bug me. Other thing I can recommend is saving LV progress, because in reality with how much Grimm can swarm you at some points and the amount of abilities you have being small in number makes keeping LVs not a big deal as recklessness can lead to you getting surrounded. Using this idea, if people wanted to start from LV 1 they can play a different character and level them up,, which in turn will go well if more characters are added like say members from Team JNPR or even Team CFVY.

Overall, for an Early Access, this game is great and I liked it a lot. Looking forward to seeing what will be in there later on in the story, what new characters will be in the game, what they'll do for the other Grimm (Like the Nevermore and the Death Stalkers) and much more. RWBY fans will certainly enjoy this, and I'm hoping eventually gamers who aren't familiar with the series will eventually look into it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before the review I must say that I do greatly enjoy RWBY.  I don't feel that would change my view of the gameplay, but it is worth mentioning.

This game is a simple yet enjoyable hack 'n' slash game that allows for up to four-player co-op.  I have seen people compare it to the Warriors games, and I feel that isn't a particularly apt comparison.  While you do fight large hordes of enemies, this game is very focused on special moves, which each character has three of.  Proper application of these special moves, as well as management of the special meter, is the key to success.

Besides the special moves, each character has a melee and ranged attack.  Repeatedly using the melee attack will lead to a combo, which a player can either do all the way to the end, or use the ranged attack button to do a different combo ender.

Since this is early access, they're only focusing on one section of gameplay at a time, and as of the time of writing that section of gameplay is only about one-two hours.  While there will be more, and I do think there is plenty of reason to replay what there is, for many that just isn't enough, and I understand that, and suggest you check back in later.  That said, the full release of the game will be more expensive, as they wish to have it be a lower price for early adopters.

If you enjoy some fun hack 'n' slash gameplay, a fun co-op time with friends, or just like the show RWBY, I think this will be a good purchase for you.
