reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a fan of hack and slash games RWBY encapsulates exactly what a hack and slash is;

Grimm Eclipse is a fun fast paced hack and slash with a massive amounts of room for growth. The combat is by no means bad but it's simple, this simplicity seperates players. To the untrained eye there are zero combos however this is untrue.

Animation cancelling is what makes a combo in this right now.
Ruby; Right before her slam attack at the end of her ground combo you can shoot, this stops yourself from being knocked up and resets your attack chain allowing you to continue a onslaught of ground based melee damage.

Another example with ruby is on her third melee swing you dodge, you should get off 4 attacks because of this, your dodge is an Iframe making it so monsters have a harder time targeting you accuratly and making it so when you should potentially get hurt you take no damage.

I would however like to see a lot more;

More melee attacks. I would like to see at least 2-3 melee attack types that you can combo and chain together

The ability to animation cancel with attack variants will greatly improve the current combat system and allow mastery over the game to those who invest time

More characters; I understand people are all over the idea of playing Ruby and the gang but with only 4 playable characters this does limit playstyle as there are not many variants to attacks other than animation cancelling and picking the strongest special ability your character has to offer.

Allowing more characters like Juane into the fray gives a massive boost in what could be done and considered possible to the developers. The addition of a new weapon and combat style in a character like Juane allows a focus on a defensive or possible protective playstyle, this however does not mean he would not dish out damage. Rather than evasion with a dodge you can be encouraged to block damage or intercept attacks with dash based specials.

The current special attack limitations are a but rough, ruby and yang having the best methods to get past this through less hits required and aura failure charging to full special respectively.
Specials should charge over time, slowly, as well as or being limited to being charged minimally by every attack rather than chaining a combo without getting struck.

I'll edit my post with updates.

The hack-and-slash mechanics could be better off with many more different combos since it gets VERY repetitive after a mere 10 minutes or so.

Hitboxes for player-ground interaction could do a lot more as well.

Environment is well-made, but can be made better, and the attack animations for all of the characters are really nice - gives that RWBY feel.

The settings interface could do with control instructions as to which button does what, because at the moment I'm still trying to figure out all the possible actions and functions in the game.

Should really add more playable characters in the future, which I think RT might do so.


But given that this is an early access game at this moment and due for improvement, I expect/hope that most of the flaws mentioned would be fixed during later development. But for now, don't expect the game to be so perfect.

I look forward to the finished product of this magnificent thing of a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely wonderful. What a great and fun early access demo. I'll get the negatives out of the way first. It is a demo, it has some FPS and simple gameplay things that can be refined, but nothing game-breaking or even annoying. It is rather short, even for an early access. The leveling up is simple, but that's not a bad thing in its own way. Storyline doesn't go very in depth, not yet at least. For $15, I don't think there was enough content either.

Now to the good things, which there is a lot of. Amazing fun, a level up system that really makes you feel the progression, dynamic gameplay, moderate skill required, problem solving, unique characters, so much fun to play with friends. I can go on but I think all I really need to say is that the good things heavily outweigh the bad.

As far as the not worth $15, yes, it alone is not worth it, but it is important to remember that you're not just buying the early access, you're supporting RoosterTeeth to continue to refine this game and make it blossom in to something AMAZING, even more than it already is. I'm a huge fan of RoosterTeeth, especially RWBY, and this game has me excited for all that is to come from it. Don't look at it as $15 for this small portion alone. Look at it as thanks to RoosterTeeth for making an amazing game to come, thanks for making an amazing series and story universe, and an investment made to help them continue to develop this title and a way to show your support for what is truly a worthy game, and a worthy developer.

I very much recommend this title.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played for barely an hour so I'm not really sure what all to say about it. It's early access, so it's still pretty rough. But it's come a long way from the pre-alpha demo that RT Sponsors got early this year, and I have a feeling we're only seeing the tip of the iceberg here.

Pros
+ It's RWBY! In video game form! Any fans of the series are going to enjoy the game just for that fact alone.
+ The playable characters (So far, just Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang) have movesets that you'd expect them to use in the show.
+ The music and scenery are all fitting for the world that it is supposed to be set in.
+ The character models, both playable and nonplayable, are spot on. If you told me they were ripped straight from the show, I'd believe it.
+ Lindsay Jones (Ruby), Kara Eberle (Weiss), Arryn Zech (Blake), and Barbara Dunkelman (Yang) all reprise their roles from the show, as well as Ryan Haywood (Professor Port) and Joel Heyman (Professor Oobleck) providing commentary and mission objective updates.
+ Patches! It seems that the development team is working hard to make sure everything is working the way it's supposed to, and their first patch came out within a few days of release.

Cons (Because this is early access, some of these can be taken with a grain of salt, as they will probably be fixed later)
- While the controls are pretty pick-up-and-play, there is no tutorial or controller map, so you're left guessing what buttons do what.
- No offline mode. You absolutely HAVE to play online.
- No matchmaking. Players are matched up entirely at random, and you can't even choose to start a room on your own. If you want to host a match, you have to hope to get lucky.
- No lock on mechanic. There's no way (as far as I can tell) to lock on to a single enemy. You're basically left to swing away until you hit something, and during heavy fighting, you can end up switching targets multiple times.
- Might just be personal, but I experienced delays in animation when characters start to run, resulting in a motionless glide across the ground.
- Minimum requirements are fairly hefty. I play some pretty intensive games on this computer, even online, but this game gets quite a bit of lag when multiple enemies and players are on screen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Extremely alpha-stage, but very fun. For those who enjoy the frantic button-bashing and reaction-based dodging of a proper hack-and-slash, but also enjoy SHOTGUN FISTS.

Characters feel very similar but at the same time a little different. You can play all of them reasonably well using the same techniques, but to get the most out of them one should adopt certain playstyles which (IMO) suit the characters really well.

Ruby does best when cleaving down hordes of Beowolves and chaining up combos quick, Weiss plays very well as an AOE-spamming crowd-controlling magic-user type, Blake works best by (again) chaining up long combos, but her special moves can flow seamlessly into regular attacks, suiting her ninjtastic style of weird deception and unpredictability. Yang? PUNCH STUFF. If you get punched to near-death, you'll only come back stronger.

Very short, but even at this early alpha stage RT have included enough stuff to have one playing the same four levels repeatedly. First to max out your level, then to complete the little challenges to unlock different techniques.

Worth the price even for the alpha, I'd say (At least, for RWBY nuts). This game's got some serious potential, still!

I shall be on the edge of my seat waiting for further updates. :D

Early Access Review

To think this began as a solo fan made project to celebrate an anniversary.
This game is a must own for any RWBY fan, in it's early access phase the controls are smooth and the combat is fluid. Currently there is no level select or way to save your progress but a full playthrough of the 4 levels should take roughly an hour. On top of 4 characters and the challenge system to unlock more upgrades,

The game is in a position where it can only better, though in it's current state it's not turning any heads and I don't think i would of purchased if I wasn't a fan of RWBY, so I would suggest to anyone who is looking at this game with no knowledge of RWBY, go watch RWBY.

All in all the developers deserve your money, they're kind hearted people and this project is more a tribute to the fans than a money making machine.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't have as much time as some people played into the game, but I feel solid with how I feel about it.

Also, heads up, I've never watched the series, so this is 100% not a fan review.

PRO's:

Gameplay is fun and addicting in my opinion, I've played as all the charcters and it definitely boild down to your play style, I like Ruby, just sayin'.

Controls on an Xbox One controller feel good, takes a little bit to get used to, and there's a thing I'd like to see added, but I'll talk about it later.

Environments look beautiful, and are well done, as well as the characters.

Supports plenty of resolutions for my 16:9 aspect ration monitor, natively 1080p but lately I've been running it at 1440p and the game supports it.

No connectivity issues (So far)

The game is very responsive with each button press, and I expect no less from the type of game this is, kind of reminds me of DMC, a little bit, definitely hack-n-slash.


CON's / Suggestions:

Animations, when going down a hill or down anything of the sort, your character decides to slide, once on level ground or going up hill it's fine, not a huge complaint, if anything just an issue that can be resolved.

No ranged weapon lock-on system, it'd be nice to have that, if anyone was a Phantasy Star Universe player I'd think RB on the Xbox controller would work nicely as the lock on, even for melee attacks it would be handy. Though on PSU it was LB but I think RB isn't being used on this game so there's a use, gimme lock on.

I'd like to see more levels, and maybe a PvP type arena. (Or PvP and Levels could be DLC)

More characters, yes please. (Maybe another possible DLC)

If at all possible, outfit variations, or completely different outfits, either to unlock by completing certain criteria, or DLC, or both. Mainly to descern who is who more easily, which I did have a problem with because I could barely read everyones Steam ID unless I was standing about 15 feet away (Totally a guess).


CONCLUSION:

I love the game and where it's headed so far, even if some of the suggestions I've said don't get implemented, I enjoy the game, and I've never watched the series! So as far as $15 is concerned, I'd buy it, well I did, but that's besides the point, one it's Rooster Teeth, I used to watch their Red Vs Blue series, LOVED it, this game, I think they'll be keeping up with it, and I know a lot of people stay away from Early Access games. It's fun, buy it, play with some friends, no friends? Make new ones who play it. Enjoy.

Rating: 8/10

Would touch Ruby again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I enjoy all RT content, this being no different. Despite being Early Access (a concept I have mixed reviews with, thanks, DayZ), I find it to be an enjoyable time consumer. I'm a huge fan of RWBY, with wall art and clothing to boot, and this pleases my inner fangirl to a large extent. However, there is not a lot of content to keep you coming back for a long long time. I've played the game over and over, unlocking content, but I've seen the end of what is here so far so I'm not looking forward to much when playing. As well, there's a game breaking bug I've experienced 3 times already where if someone disconnects during a wave, the next wave won't spawn, and everyone must leave the game, that's it.

However, it's 16 bucks, that's a damn good price for a game that will absolutely continue to be worked on, I have entire faith in RT to continue their work on this game, unlike some others (ahem, DayZ).

Would absolutely recommend this game to anyone that's a fan, and I look forward to future updates. If you're considering getting this, but don't want to pay for something with limited content (for now), I'd still get it, because I can personally promise that this game will continue to be worked on regularily, I trust Rooster Teeth with everything they do.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm awful at sentences but there are a few things I'd like to see addressed, so bullet points yay:

Pros:
-Characters transitioned rather well into the game, Yang plays like Yang, Weiss plays like Weiss, etc. Dedicated voices help in favor tremendously
-Scenery is wonderful, if maybe a tad barren
-Sound effects are right on the money.
-Game is a joy to play with friends/a proper team

Cons:
-Hit or miss Hit Detection. Maybe it's just my aim but I swear those grimm kinda feel like they only get hit when they want to.
-Area of Effect abilities outclass one hit moves by a mile. Since your usual enemies are hordes of grimm, things like Quake for Yang or Nova for Weiss are almost always the better option against everything that isn't a single enemy
-Enemy movement is a bit disjointed, really only notice it for the boar but at times enemies feel like they jump and stutter so as to avoid getting hit
-While graphically the game is pretty, the areas themselves feel rather barren. Besides the spare artifact here and there there's not a whole lot to find. Like Mountain Glenn, plenty of debris and busted buildings to look at but never explore.
-Although it's short, not being able to pick up where I left off with just myself or my friends can be a bit of a pain. I see this getting fixed seeing as how there's not many areas but you can only build team RWBY so many different ways to blast through the same 5 areas.
-Needs more combos
-Not enough JNPR.

This game's potential is absolutely insane, seeing as how it's Early Access I'm super excited for what the future holds as I feel most of my gripes are soon to be nonexistent. Plus if they add more characters that adds that much more replayability. I know there are cons now but make no mistake this game is still fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is entertaining enough. The moba style leveling system is different for a run around beat-em up style game making things entertaining and interesting.

So far with it only having 4 levels each taking about 10-15 minutes a piece it is very short but pretty fun while it lasts.

With that being said it is still early access and full of bugs, some of them come in the form of broken subtitles. If the particular line is long and the character keeps talking the subtitles only follow through the first initial burst of words and doesn't continue to follow along.

Another bug that I came across while playing earlier took place during the bomb sequence. A player pressed the switch to open the door before prompted and was ejected from the level into an endless abyss to which myself and another player ended up when we responded next to them.

That being said it is still pretty enjoyable. The characters for how little they seem to talk do still hold true to their personalities in the show.

Here is hoping that in the future we can play as other characters such as Jaune, Pyrrha, Nora, ect.

10/10 would break the game again.

Early Access Review

PC Specs:
i3 3.1
GTX 660
8GIG DDR3 RAM
Windows 8.1

I will keep this review brief as i want to get back to killing with my friends!

Rwby is hack and slash adapted from an anime that I have never seen but might due to the awesomeness of this game.

Pros:

* Beautiful art style
* Combat is intense and fast paced
* Movement feels natural and flows nicely
* Can be played solo or with friends
* Like with LOL and DOTA you earn levels and use points to unlock enhanced versions of attacks or buff general things, e/g more health, power bra etc.
* Runs really well from ULTRA to POTATO (yes potato is the lowest setting) I did laugh very loud apon seeing this!
* 4 Different people to play as
* Varied locations

Cons:

* While combat is fun it isnt extensive by any means (This is early access so give it time)
* You gain exp by last hitting which can be troublesome
* Recycled enemies
* Ai isnt the greatest but is decent-ish
* All 4 partners feel samey as I am guessing they didnt want certain people to be useless at certain sections of the game.

All in all RWBY is a great hack and slash and is worth the money but I understand if you want to hold off for a while as most of us have benn burned by EA games (Dayz).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far, Grimm Eclipse is a very promising game.

Pros:
-Really true to the lore of the show
-Everything looks amazing, and it runs ok for the graphics (I'll get back to this one)
-Great time playing alone or online
-Challenging, but fair, Nothing is impossible, you just need to use some strategy

Cons:
-The framerate, oh GOD the framerate! Its not bad at all with one or two people because there aren't as manny grimm all        at once, but with three or four players, waves can have up to 40 grimm. This leads to quite a bit of lag and you get maybe 5-10 fps. That quickly ends as enemies start dying, though.
-No definitive end. After the second Mountain Glenn level, the game just goes back to the title screen. I'm pretty sure its just a bug, but it has always happened for me. (Edit: I now see that it says end of campaign 1, but the first few times it wasn't there or I didn't see it and it was confusing)

Overall, this is a great game for fans of RWBY, or hack-and-slash games in generall. As of early December, 2015, its not worth the $15 price except for die hard fans, but it looks to get much better as time goes on and the price will be worth it soon.

I'd give it an 8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW ALMOST EVERYTHING IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE*
As a fan of RWBY, when I saw this I Cried tears of joy, I scrownged up 15 dollars and got to playing.
Honestly for a Product, it dosen't come with much as of right now, only three levels and four characters, but what it lacks in quantity, it shines in quality. The gameplay acts as a Co-op Hack and slash type, which in my opinion is a really enjoyable experience. Most of the Characters have the Original Voice cast, but strangely Blake sounds a bit different for some odd reason, perhaps its how the game is directed or a different Voice-Actor all together, But thats a small detail.
Each Character has a different Skill Tree, and most of those skills are unlocked through Challanges, in which is actually a good Idea believe it or not, It encourages a different way of playing everytime. The Skills are the same set always and they don't sinergize with the combos very well, but again this is Early Access, so theres alot of room for Improvment.

Pros
-A RWBY Game Yeah!!!
-Gameplay is Enjoyable and not tedious [Looking at you Dynasty Warriors]
-All of Team RWBY is present
-The Level Design is pleasing
-Promising game
-Music is on point

Cons [Honestly these are more as Nitpicks at best.]
-Walking animation is a bit wonky with a few Characters
-Needs more Customization with Combos
-Voice-actors are a bit lacking

Overall as this game is now, Id give this game a solid
7/10 As of Day 1 this game is amazing, Hoping for some updates and more levels!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start with a review for this.
First off, I love this game, for an early access title, it plays good. However, there's no reason to be biased, let me list the pros and cons to this game.

Pros:
-Dynasty Warriors and Left 4 Dead Co-op gameplay
-Characters have good personalities from the start, and the voice acting is great
-The game seems to have a great way of server connection, with my internet being bad 90% of the time, I never have problems connecting to another player's game
-Each character has their own skill trees, attacks, combos, etc.
-The Ultra setting looks amazing, I recommend building a PC for it
Cons:
-While it is Early Access, the animations are a bit choppy/delayed
-Doubles. By this, I mean that everyone can play as the same character (example: Four Weiss, Ruby, Yang, and Blake) leaving out so much variation at some parts of the game, making it not as fun when someone is playing as a double character.
-No voice chat, while this is a minor problem, it'd be easier to use voice chat instead of typing so you can easily communicate in the middle of battling
-No character saving, making it a bit tedious at times to play the same mission over again and starting back at level one
-Unless you're a RWBY fan, you won't understand much of the game

Now, here's some recommendations I'd like to see as the game updates and gets more larger:
-More characters or teams. It would be cool to be able to play as teams like JNPR or CFVY and be able to play as the characters from said teams
-Fix the Idle and Running animations
-Make character restrictions, so there's more variation in matches

Other than that, it's a great game with solid combat, great voice acting, and interesting story, I personally give it a 9/10
If you want to support RoosterTeeth, I recommend picking up the game while it's in early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been following RWBY from season 1 Episode 1. It was amazing. And I like the whole gameplay. It's smooth on my computer but i have a gtx 970 and it runs great. They kept the same animation style from the show by that i mean the graphics. Each character lives up to its rep and its overall just great. Some things i noticed though.

Weiss- Her Barrage tends to not have as long a range as it probably should and on occasion 3/5 or 4/9 of the bullets will just go aimlessly on into the abyss.

Ruby- I haven't played her too much but holy ♥♥♥♥ is she fun. However. Her second ability (i believe it is called cresendo) You launch in the air and come spinning down in a blade dance of red death. REALLY COOL. But theres no auto aim on it. It requires skill its not a glitch. I absolutely love it.

Blake- Meh. It's Blake. The most badass faunus kitten on the face of the planet. Essentially a teleporting neko. With two swords. It's also a gun. All of her skills are fun and for the most part well rounded.

Yang- Hm.... The only thing i didn't like was that the starting (i forget the name of it but you shoot a explosive round at the ground in front of you works just as well) <-- that thing. It's starting range was crap. It's supposed to be an AOE attack but it has no A to its OE. Other than that. It's Yang. The big breasted brawler. No negatives there.

NOW WHAT I WOULD LIKE TO SEE IN A LATER EDITION OF THIS GAME.
Customization.
And by that i mean.
YOU JUST GOT OUTTA SIGNAL WITH YOUR OWN WEAPON THAT YOU MADE! WHOOOOO
By this I mean within reason you get to build your weapon. Colorize it and then use it in a display of battle.
But i mean it has to work. Your dagger cant turn into a rocket launcher.

ALSO SEMBLANCES
These are... Superpowers. For lack of a better term.
In the show We quite a few.
Ruby's superspeed. Weiss can make Glyphs (...er...Landmines? Not sure how to put it.)
Yang turns into a hulk. Blake makes shadow clones.... Not a naruto reference.

I would love to see this game complete with as many aspects of the show while still being the fun and amazing game that it has been made to be so far.

And to those who look at it and are like... Meh... Buy it. Support it. This game is already amazing. Just buying it helps it along and who knows. You just might like it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A thoroughly fun game that I feel has plenty of replay-ability. Very tight controls and great combat. The abilities are suprisingly difficult to master though incredibly rewarding when you pull off combos.

My only issue is with the mana or special power system, which doesn't regenerate outside of combat and is only refilled by levelling up or landing large enough hit combos. This tends to hamper play quite a lot - often I found that going into a combat instance with a full power bar would have been nice, rather than being forced to quickly fill and instantly use generated power.

Overall tremendously entertaining and incredibly satisfying for a fan of both Dynasty Warrior and RWBY :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Aaaand I finally got it!

After months of playing Smite and thirsting for something a little more than laning with a bunch of creeps (I mean minions... not.. you know.. creepy dudes) I finally got my hands on a game I've been waiting for since season 1 of RWBY.

Although, now I kinda have to get used to relying on a host's internet connection again (brings me back to the COD days). But this isn't that big of a deal and also there really is no one you're competing with, or rather against, here. Just some hack 'n' slash fun. And boy do I love it. This being early access, I know there's a lot more to improve, but I can already see a bright future ahead for this game.

There's a lot of elements to the game that really glued me to my seat upon my first try. Aesthetically, the graphics look great. The UI is not too crowded and targeters help guide where you wana keep looking at. The characters' attacks and abilities and their animations are smashing... literally. And I don't think I need to say more about our beloved characters.

As for gameplay, it didn't take me too long, but I had to get used to staying on 1 Grimm during basic attacks. The camera would shift little by little as you progress through a characters attack chain and this causes a target switch. But once you get used to this everything's going to go a lot smoother. [Either this is actually a thing or I subconciously move my mouse little by little while I use basic attacks lol]

THE ABILITIES! Love it. Love the mechanics and the progression. It's like I'm in a moba or an RPG. Feels good when you can finally fire 5 projectiles at a time after holding the ability going haaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh"....... tmi

So far this game looks promising and is already a lot of fun. I highly recommend it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW: So, other than optimization issues and bugs (which as anyone on Steam will say always come with early access games), the foundation Rooster Teeth is putting out right now is incredibly solid. Pretty much feels like a complete game so far, that just needs some more content in the long run.
The currently available gamemode is a nice mix of MOBA elements with the typical campaign/story mode system of levels with progressing difficulty, which (at least personally) I haven't really ever seen before in a multiplayer game.
That being said, I have do an issue with the design choice of allowing players to all pick the same character as each other in a game. Forcing players to each pick a different character and switch up their playstyle couldn't be that harsh of a restriction, and honestly could lead to more interesting sessions instead of four Ruby's with dust nukes.
However, if Rooster Teeth does decide to add more characters, I think it would be amazing to not restrict four player teams to only the four characters of a team. Allowing players to mix and match different characters from different teams would create some incredible synergy with all of the combinations people come up with. However, I imagine the work load would be a lot more than just restricting players to a single team for a session, because it would require literally balancing everyone with everyone.
Of course these ideas come from someone who has never actually made a videogame, and are really just things that one person would like to see come along in the game. I could also just be repeating what's already known, so yeah.

Wow. After only fifty minutes of playing this Rooster Teeth Game, I am enjoying it  a lot .
Pros:
It's a challenge when in combat, especially when you've got to defend your area.
The game is really well optimized, I can run this game on Ultra graphics without any real frame drop, and my computer is more in the lower budget section.
For the price, and the fact the game is in early access, the quality of the game is better than the previous Rooster Teeth Game.
I've only played as Yang during my time on the game, but, the dialogue that she has, is great, including the phrases she says after defeating an enemy.
The map randomly generates the area in front of you if you die, or restart the mission, which is great when you want to play the game over and over again, and still enjoy it.

Cons:
The collectables appear to be really easy to find.
The animation for you running keeps on going for a few seconds after you stop.

I lasted a full three hours before I broke down and bought this game.
I have the original, original demo still; and holy crap, this is one of the biggest improvements in a game I've ever seen.
There isn't a whole lot to the game yet; though it's definitely got potential. I find it both enjoyable and pretty fun.

I would like to give a suggestion about making characters like Roman Torchwick and the villians from the series playable. I mean, how cool would it be to play as Cinder or Neo? I'd probably even play as Neon Katt if you decide to add her in at some point, too. Because roller blades are cool.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game shows a lot of promise, even in it's early access state. It's extremely fun, especially with 3 friends, and for it to be this early access, it's very impressive. There aren't really any noted game-breaking bugs, there are a few balance issues and mechanic issues, but overall it's fairly solid. The only primary issue is that there is no in-game sound effect slider, which leaves gameplay to be eardrum-blowlingly loud. On first startup, game music and voices are also very loud, but in the options there is a spot to turn down the volume, but for sound effects there isn't, so they stay extremely loud.

Many other fans and I would certainly love to see a patch allowing better sounds control ASAP.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When it comes to anything about RWBY, I'm something of a zealot: music, pictures, the show, and now the game. I absolutely LOVE RWBY, and thankfully RWBY: Grimm Eclipse does not disappoint in the slightest.

It's a really good action-adventure hack-n-slash with pretty good mechanics, fun dialogue/SFX/audio, and lots of over the top action that we're all used to from the show. I'm so hyped for when they add more characters (here's hoping that team STRQ gets added at some point). I'll admit, the game feels a tad basic at times, but it's still early access, so I'm not worried. Even if it weren't, it'd still be a really, REALLY good game.

All I can say is that this is a 10/10 game, unless you're a RWBY fan, which makes it an 11/10. Highly recommend getting it first chance you get!

Rest in peace, Monty: your work - and now legacy - continues to inspire and entertain countless lives. The world is a smaller place without you.

Never stop moving forward.""

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For me this game is worth the price tag for a couple of reasons, one is that I am a big fan of the RWBY series and Rooster Teeth in general and felt that offering $15 to help them progress in a field that they haven't really ventured into before is a small price to pay. Secondly, the game is actually very fun to play for a while. It's not Skyrim. I doubt you'll see anyone putting thousands of hours into this game, but for a couple hours of play its very worth it. And that was just my solo experiece, I'm sure it would be a bit more fun with friends to play with.

Now of course the game has its problems. It is a very early access game with a lot of potential for improvement.
The main issues are the sound design with a few issues regarding the movement animations. But for the most part the game looks pretty good and plays well. I do think that the number of enemies needs to be increased a bit or for a difficulty option to be added since the fights get a bit repetitive and predictable. Hopefully with some feedback and time though there can be features added to this game to make it just that much better.

Tl;DR: Fun game for a decent price with a few issues that will be improved upon with time but do not detract from the experience.

voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is something to behold thats for sure. But where do i begin? The game it's self plays smoothly and fluently with the ocasional graphical glitch here and there but besides that the game has a rather unique fighting and leveling system.

The fighting is kind of like an MOBA but with the touch of your average fighting game with one default combo that can be ended with a signature move. The special moves are something that really cought my interest, they're all different and have a certain litte touch to them that make it so well, special!

The leveling system is the usual system beat enemies get XP same old same old, but in this there are artifacts hidden all around the levels that'll help you level up, you can also get some free XP by finding it in crates, other than that it's the same.

The characters are something good to, it isnt just the same person with a different skin, each character is uniqe, for example Weiss is a squishy character that can do massive amounts of damage to single opponents unlike Ruby who can do moderate damage to an area of enemies.

Also want to point out one of the video settings is called 'Potatoe'

The game is outstanding for early access BUT it does have some things that could be fixed, for example when moving the character, upon stopping you'll still be doing the running animation, not that bad but really annoys me and others probably, the difficulty is unbelievable, especially when playing with friends and there isnt a way to change it, you cant save your progress and the story mode is really short so far, took me and my friend an hour to beat it so yea that could be fixed but other than that the game holds great potential and will hopfully live up to the hype.

I give this game 7.3/10
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI am loving this game so far. It's pretty impressive given how buggy and lagging it can be sometimes, but it seems to capture what I love about the show: guns + weapon + monster killing = pure awesome!! I wish the gun shooting had an aiming system of some sort though or a lock-on mechanic in general , and there were some easier what to use the points I get from leveling to upgrade myself without having stop and pause from the action for a bit and slow down the other players in the process. A tutorial of some form in the beginning would be nice since I spent the first few minutes trying to figure out how move around using my keyboard and still haven't quite mastered all the controls because I just realized there was a gun button after just right clicking. Some of the other thing complaints I have are just simple things like my level for the character I was using not saving and having to start over in the first area everytime I start a new match, but those are things I know and strongly believe will be fixed overtime as this an early access game. I've crashed once so far, and that just a few minutes ago, but I hope my input has helped. I still think this is great game, even for early access, and I know it will get better as the bugs are tuned out and the game becomes cleanly polished.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile still very early on in development the game has a lot of noticable flaws, but also a lot of noticable quirks that make it lovable, characters are pretty unbalanced as far as team RWBY goes, highly noticable but don't let that stop you from playing your favorite of the four. Overall it takes about 30-35 minutes to finish the first (and only) available campaign. All your favorite voice actresses from the show are present in the game as well as the few current male voices available. The sound quality is great and the music is really nice to listen to wether you're running through nature or taking it to the Grimm. This is definitely a game that is more fun with multiple people, at least two are recommended if you plan to run this, solo it gets stale pretty quickly and it's fun to see who can rack the highest score at the end of each stage. Overall right now I'd give the game an 8/10 due to the apparent problems which are still being worked on and patched as they make fixes. Is the game worth 14.99? Absolutely I'd say, I've found myself playing this time and time again with friends and strangers alike whenever I feel the need to let off some stress from work or just a bad day. Overall I say give this game a try if you're a fan of the show, just be ready to see some obvious flaws.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile there isn't much in the game right now, it still has a pretty solid base for it's combat, and considering it just entered early access, the content thing isn't going to be a problem for too long. On the other hand, they should probably work out some more bugs before they start adding anything too big. None of the bugs I've encountered are paticularly intrusive, in fact most of them are apparently very useful for speedruns, and even then I probably woundn't have noticed most of them if my friend hadn't shown me, but they are very easy to find if you know they are there. Also, the game actually recognizes my ps4 controller on it's own, which is something that I've seen much more prominent games with much larger budgets completely ignore.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been following RWBY from season 1 Episode 1. It was amazing. And I like the whole gameplay. It's smooth on my computer but i have a gtx 970 and it runs great. They kept the same animation style from the show by that i mean the graphics. Each character lives up to its rep and its overall just great. Some things i noticed though.

Weiss- Her Barrage tends to not have as long a range as it probably should and on occasion 3/5 or 4/9 of the bullets will just go aimlessly on into the abyss.

Ruby- I haven't played her too much but holy ♥♥♥♥ is she fun. However. Her second ability (i believe it is called cresendo) You launch in the air and come spinning down in a blade dance of red death. REALLY COOL. But theres no auto aim on it. It requires skill its not a glitch. I absolutely love it.

Blake- Meh. It's Blake. The most badass faunus kitten on the face of the planet. Essentially a teleporting neko. With two swords. It's also a gun. All of her skills are fun and for the most part well rounded.

Yang- Hm.... The only thing i didn't like was that the starting (i forget the name of it but you shoot a explosive round at the ground in front of you works just as well) <-- that thing. It's starting range was crap. It's supposed to be an AOE attack but it has no A to its OE. Other than that. It's Yang. The big breasted brawler. No negatives there.

NOW WHAT I WOULD LIKE TO SEE IN A LATER EDITION OF THIS GAME.
Customization.
And by that i mean.
YOU JUST GOT OUTTA SIGNAL WITH YOUR OWN WEAPON THAT YOU MADE! WHOOOOO
By this I mean within reason you get to build your weapon. Colorize it and then use it in a display of battle.
But i mean it has to work. Your dagger cant turn into a rocket launcher.

ALSO SEMBLANCES
These are... Superpowers. For lack of a better term.
In the show We quite a few.
Ruby's superspeed. Weiss can make Glyphs (...er...Landmines? Not sure how to put it.)
Yang turns into a hulk. Blake makes shadow clones.... Not a naruto reference.

I would love to see this game complete with as many aspects of the show while still being the fun and amazing game that it has been made to be so far.

And to those who look at it and are like... Meh... Buy it. Support it. This game is already amazing. Just buying it helps it along and who knows. You just might like it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nRWBY: Grimm Eclipse turned a week old recently, and I fell in love with the game. Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang are unique from each other, and I love to play as all four huntresses. The soundtrack that plays when playing the game is really good, and the controls are not stiff. I love the gameplay as well, and the teammates you play with are supportive (after all, working as a team is crucial when playing multiplayer). I may love the game, but there are two flaws that makes me cringe a bit. First comes from the lag that may occur if too many things are going around. I am only referring to certain enemy attacks or the loads of enemies that appear when battling, but the rest of the game runs smoothly which I like. Secondly and possibly the most important is the experience players receive when playing online. Artifacts, exp orbs, and wave clearances are fine, but getting exp from Grimm becomes an issue. The exp is given ONLY to the player who finished off the Grimm, and that can be frustrating, especially those who took so long to weaken the enemy and all of that is ruin when someone else takes it out. So why not instead have assist exp for those who help out fighting Grimm a player is having issues with. The person who took it out will get the most experience, but players who helped out can also get experience so it can be fair for everyone. Overall, the game is enjoyable especially with people online, and I bet the team is still creating some new features and fixing bugs and hiccups for the game. I reccomend this game to anyone who loves RWBY and/or hack-and-slash games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW: So, other than optimization issues and bugs (which as anyone on Steam will say always come with early access games), the foundation Rooster Teeth is putting out right now is incredibly solid. Pretty much feels like a complete game so far, that just needs some more content in the long run.
The currently available gamemode is a nice mix of MOBA elements with the typical campaign/story mode system of levels with progressing difficulty, which (at least personally) I haven't really ever seen before in a multiplayer game.
That being said, I have do an issue with the design choice of allowing players to all pick the same character as each other in a game. Forcing players to each pick a different character and switch up their playstyle couldn't be that harsh of a restriction, and honestly could lead to more interesting sessions instead of four Ruby's with dust nukes.
However, if Rooster Teeth does decide to add more characters, I think it would be amazing to not restrict four player teams to only the four characters of a team. Allowing players to mix and match different characters from different teams would create some incredible synergy with all of the combinations people come up with. However, I imagine the work load would be a lot more than just restricting players to a single team for a session, because it would require literally balancing everyone with everyone.
Of course these ideas come from someone who has never actually made a videogame, and are really just things that one person would like to see come along in the game. I could also just be repeating what's already known, so yeah.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow. After only fifty minutes of playing this Rooster Teeth Game, I am enjoying it  a lot .
Pros:
It's a challenge when in combat, especially when you've got to defend your area.
The game is really well optimized, I can run this game on Ultra graphics without any real frame drop, and my computer is more in the lower budget section.
For the price, and the fact the game is in early access, the quality of the game is better than the previous Rooster Teeth Game.
I've only played as Yang during my time on the game, but, the dialogue that she has, is great, including the phrases she says after defeating an enemy.
The map randomly generates the area in front of you if you die, or restart the mission, which is great when you want to play the game over and over again, and still enjoy it.

Cons:
The collectables appear to be really easy to find.
The animation for you running keeps on going for a few seconds after you stop.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just got into this game. So far, I enjoy it.

+Graphics are great. It feels immersive when I run through the stage.
+Fighting mechanics are great so far. I didn't notice any gameplay bugs or problems while I am fighting an enemy.
+Music is enjoyable. It's captures the music of the RWBY show itself.
+Ability and level-up features are great.

However, I do notice some parts of the game that need improvement:

-The camera angling needs work. I find myself adjusting the camera so that I am able to see the enemy I'm fighting directly.
-A dash mechanic would be nice. It kind of feels dragged out when I'm taking some time trying to get from one place to another.
-It's a small thing, but it would be cool if the radar on the top left shows the terrain.
-Some graphical dynamics would help give the game more oomph" when you are using a special attack or a crazy combo.
-A manual lock-on feature would help me shoot the correct enemy from afar.
-Sound effects could need some variety. For example
date: there could be something like varied pitches of the same sound effect.\n\nFor what it is
recommended: I like the game. I can't wait to see what Rooster Teeth has in store.\n\nBtw
hoursPlayed: I should really consider watching the show itself ^^;"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile still very early on in development the game has a lot of noticable flaws, but also a lot of noticable quirks that make it lovable, characters are pretty unbalanced as far as team RWBY goes, highly noticable but don't let that stop you from playing your favorite of the four. Overall it takes about 30-35 minutes to finish the first (and only) available campaign. All your favorite voice actresses from the show are present in the game as well as the few current male voices available. The sound quality is great and the music is really nice to listen to wether you're running through nature or taking it to the Grimm. This is definitely a game that is more fun with multiple people, at least two are recommended if you plan to run this, solo it gets stale pretty quickly and it's fun to see who can rack the highest score at the end of each stage. Overall right now I'd give the game an 8/10 due to the apparent problems which are still being worked on and patched as they make fixes. Is the game worth 14.99? Absolutely I'd say, I've found myself playing this time and time again with friends and strangers alike whenever I feel the need to let off some stress from work or just a bad day. Overall I say give this game a try if you're a fan of the show, just be ready to see some obvious flaws.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is just a quick summary of what I have to say about it...

First off, this game is the best early access I've ever played.
And being an early access, be prepared for a lot of missing content, shallow gameplay/story, glitches, and so forth.

Biggest cons:
-You will pretty much experience the whole game in about 8 hours tops.
-Not much of a campaign.
-Barely any settings can be change to accomodate for low-end PCs
-Glitchy/weird physics
-No progress saving
-No single-player

Biggest pros:
-Amazing graphics
-Non-stop, challenging action
-Amazing soundtrack
-Detailed, characters. levels/maps
-Amazing voice acting
-Looks EXACTLY like the show

So, unless you are a die-hard RWBY fan like me, don't buy this game...YET; wait until more updates, unless you want to buy it just to support development. (It is Rooster Teeth's first game)

And I have no clue where to put suggestions so I'm gonna put them here.
These are in order of greatest importance

-Add in depth setting changes first off, my game lags so bad it is barely playable (my PC can handle other games like Call of Duty/Battlefield/Command and Conquer with ease, permitted I first turn down the graphics (hey, gameplay > graphics)

-Add a controlable targetting system

-Add SAVING PROGRESS

-Add single-player

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let's Review...RWBY: Grimm Eclipse.

If somehow you didn't know, RWBY: Grimm Eclipse is a hack-and-slash game by RoosterTeeth Games. As far as i'm aware, this would be their second game and it is pretty well-off for early access.

The Menu:
Yeah, sure; The menu isn't super technical and may not be as flashy as other games, but it does carry itself with the font and color. I know it's probably not noticable, but it does make a visual difference.

The Settings:
Just looking at face value, the settings seem to be very bare-bones and simplistic. Now, one could argue that the enjoyment is really more gated towards gameplay instead of having you fiddle around in the resolution and graphical differences. But on the other hand, getting the best possible qualtiy from your equipment or visual enjoyment is what some people strive for. It's a mixed bag for me.

Now the main part, The Gameplay:
There isn't a single-player campaign mode, but you can access a sort of pseudo-single player by establishing a private lobby and just hopping in to the carnage by yourself. The online mode is more focused on. You can join in a Quick Match, create a new lobby with New Game, the previously mentioned Play with Friends, and lastly just straight up leave like you never wanted to be there anyway (Exiting highly un-recommended).

The player models are intact and are retty close to what you would see in the show. The animations are pretty good and very fluid. Since it IS in developement, there was maybe one or two hiccups for me, but they corrected themselves. There is a respawn and revive system, but it leans more towards having you get revived rather than respawning.

The combat is very hack-and-slash, reminiscent of almost Devil May Cry or even Dynasty Warriors. The abilities are super helpful when crowded by Grimm, but you only get to a cerain level so not all upgrades can be unlocked, so choose carefully. There about 3 abilities to choose from and are quite similar between characters (Weiss' Nova and Yang's Quake) are both AoE attackes and the difference is just the effect it has...which could mean they're different?

The environment are scenic and pretty, but they do have a sort of Tales of feel. You know, where the plains are absurdely large and there are only enough monsters for about an eighth of the filed, that's how RWBY: GRimm Eclipse plays it and it's not so bad when you playing with four people (The fieds flood with darkness), but by anything less than 2, the field is just to big. Other than that, it works well.

My suggestions and Thoughts:
This are all open to discussion from you all (Players of RWBY: GRimm Eclipse and/or  others). Don't get me wrong, RWBY: Grimm Eclipse is a great game and good starting point to further developement, but it's far from complete.
I'm not to miffed at the menues or the settings. Could they be improved upon, but not in any need for a complete overhaul. The lobby system the game uses is also fine. Within point, Nothing technical needs to change.

The combat works as is, but tere should be more skills to choose from or implement semblances as a 4 skill that uses all special at once. The skill trees fit their purpose, however I feel as though if they maybe implemented the passive skills in with active skills it would look more like a tree, or even include more specific passive skills that increase damage, range etc. of the active skills.

In regard to the environment, although lovely and battle spacious, in my mind it feels like there is hidden potential in it. Maybe, have class assignments that fall like dead-drops and add more challenges or specific condition for bonus EXP. You could also add a mini boss, beside Alpha Beowolves and Ursas.

And just for kicks (Kinda serious) there is only one thing that I can think that may just be fan service and not really the best choice for overall developement. But what if there was an option to model and script you own character into the game. Now, I understand some people could easily turn this into a bad thing, but there are also good things that could come from it. I don't know, just food for thought.

Although this review may have came off as strangely negative, I hold nothing but the highest regards and faith in RooserTeeth Games in making RWBY: Grimm Eclipse one of the greats. So to you, The Members of the RoosterTeeth Games crew, Keep up the Great work.

Love <3...Platonically of course.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played for barely an hour so I'm not really sure what all to say about it. It's early access, so it's still pretty rough. But it's come a long way from the pre-alpha demo that RT Sponsors got early this year, and I have a feeling we're only seeing the tip of the iceberg here.

Pros
+ It's RWBY! In video game form! Any fans of the series are going to enjoy the game just for that fact alone.
+ The playable characters (So far, just Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang) have movesets that you'd expect them to use in the show.
+ The music and scenery are all fitting for the world that it is supposed to be set in.
+ The character models, both playable and nonplayable, are spot on. If you told me they were ripped straight from the show, I'd believe it.
+ Lindsay Jones (Ruby), Kara Eberle (Weiss), Arryn Zech (Blake), and Barbara Dunkelman (Yang) all reprise their roles from the show, as well as Ryan Haywood (Professor Port) and Joel Heyman (Professor Oobleck) providing commentary and mission objective updates.
+ Patches! It seems that the development team is working hard to make sure everything is working the way it's supposed to, and their first patch came out within a few days of release.

Cons (Because this is early access, some of these can be taken with a grain of salt, as they will probably be fixed later)
- While the controls are pretty pick-up-and-play, there is no tutorial or controller map, so you're left guessing what buttons do what.
- No offline mode. You absolutely HAVE to play online.
- No matchmaking. Players are matched up entirely at random, and you can't even choose to start a room on your own. If you want to host a match, you have to hope to get lucky.
- No lock on mechanic. There's no way (as far as I can tell) to lock on to a single enemy. You're basically left to swing away until you hit something, and during heavy fighting, you can end up switching targets multiple times.
- Might just be personal, but I experienced delays in animation when characters start to run, resulting in a motionless glide across the ground.
- Minimum requirements are fairly hefty. I play some pretty intensive games on this computer, even online, but this game gets quite a bit of lag when multiple enemies and players are on screen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't have as much time as some people played into the game, but I feel solid with how I feel about it.

Also, heads up, I've never watched the series, so this is 100% not a fan review.

PRO's:

Gameplay is fun and addicting in my opinion, I've played as all the charcters and it definitely boild down to your play style, I like Ruby, just sayin'.

Controls on an Xbox One controller feel good, takes a little bit to get used to, and there's a thing I'd like to see added, but I'll talk about it later.

Environments look beautiful, and are well done, as well as the characters.

Supports plenty of resolutions for my 16:9 aspect ration monitor, natively 1080p but lately I've been running it at 1440p and the game supports it.

No connectivity issues (So far)

The game is very responsive with each button press, and I expect no less from the type of game this is, kind of reminds me of DMC, a little bit, definitely hack-n-slash.


CON's / Suggestions:

Animations, when going down a hill or down anything of the sort, your character decides to slide, once on level ground or going up hill it's fine, not a huge complaint, if anything just an issue that can be resolved.

No ranged weapon lock-on system, it'd be nice to have that, if anyone was a Phantasy Star Universe player I'd think RB on the Xbox controller would work nicely as the lock on, even for melee attacks it would be handy. Though on PSU it was LB but I think RB isn't being used on this game so there's a use, gimme lock on.

I'd like to see more levels, and maybe a PvP type arena. (Or PvP and Levels could be DLC)

More characters, yes please. (Maybe another possible DLC)

If at all possible, outfit variations, or completely different outfits, either to unlock by completing certain criteria, or DLC, or both. Mainly to descern who is who more easily, which I did have a problem with because I could barely read everyones Steam ID unless I was standing about 15 feet away (Totally a guess).


CONCLUSION:

I love the game and where it's headed so far, even if some of the suggestions I've said don't get implemented, I enjoy the game, and I've never watched the series! So as far as $15 is concerned, I'd buy it, well I did, but that's besides the point, one it's Rooster Teeth, I used to watch their Red Vs Blue series, LOVED it, this game, I think they'll be keeping up with it, and I know a lot of people stay away from Early Access games. It's fun, buy it, play with some friends, no friends? Make new ones who play it. Enjoy.

Rating: 8/10

Would touch Ruby again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is entertaining enough. The moba style leveling system is different for a run around beat-em up style game making things entertaining and interesting.

So far with it only having 4 levels each taking about 10-15 minutes a piece it is very short but pretty fun while it lasts.

With that being said it is still early access and full of bugs, some of them come in the form of broken subtitles. If the particular line is long and the character keeps talking the subtitles only follow through the first initial burst of words and doesn't continue to follow along.

Another bug that I came across while playing earlier took place during the bomb sequence. A player pressed the switch to open the door before prompted and was ejected from the level into an endless abyss to which myself and another player ended up when we responded next to them.

That being said it is still pretty enjoyable. The characters for how little they seem to talk do still hold true to their personalities in the show.

Here is hoping that in the future we can play as other characters such as Jaune, Pyrrha, Nora, ect.

10/10 would break the game again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PC Specs:
i3 3.1
GTX 660
8GIG DDR3 RAM
Windows 8.1

I will keep this review brief as i want to get back to killing with my friends!

Rwby is hack and slash adapted from an anime that I have never seen but might due to the awesomeness of this game.

Pros:

* Beautiful art style
* Combat is intense and fast paced
* Movement feels natural and flows nicely
* Can be played solo or with friends
* Like with LOL and DOTA you earn levels and use points to unlock enhanced versions of attacks or buff general things, e/g more health, power bra etc.
* Runs really well from ULTRA to POTATO (yes potato is the lowest setting) I did laugh very loud apon seeing this!
* 4 Different people to play as
* Varied locations

Cons:

* While combat is fun it isnt extensive by any means (This is early access so give it time)
* You gain exp by last hitting which can be troublesome
* Recycled enemies
* Ai isnt the greatest but is decent-ish
* All 4 partners feel samey as I am guessing they didnt want certain people to be useless at certain sections of the game.

All in all RWBY is a great hack and slash and is worth the money but I understand if you want to hold off for a while as most of us have benn burned by EA games (Dayz).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being the first RWBY game (I think) It’s not bad so far.

Sound isn’t the best. Especially when it comes to jumping and landing on the ground. There’s also the sort of stale lack of variety combat? (I am speaking as someone who has ONLY played as Weiss. So for all I know the issue can be limited to just her) There aren’t really much combos. It’s spam a physical attack or a long distance attack and then your special meter lets you use like more fancy attacks. But you have to actually build it up and it drains fast. So pretty much it seems like most of the time you’ll use the same basic button mashing attack the majority of the time which can sorta get a little stale after a while?

I mean when you compare it to some other similar beat em up hack and slash fight fight hoard games I’ve played like Pirate Warriors for example which is just Dynasty but One Piece from what I understand, the focus should have been on making basic non special meter required attacks more fun with more variety. (Despite this I mean it is still slightly satisfying to spam it on enemies regardless but clearly I recognize that there's more potential to be had)

Visuals are actually pretty nice. The landscape and lighting (Of course the characters are always kinda glowing and never change no matter what type of lighting you’re in) are rather nice. And I do enjoy that there’s some down time with the world feeling fairly big (But only so much so, it’s a linear game)

I would have liked maybe a little moooore exploration but this game is probably designed with the intent that players would rather rush it and fight fight fight.

My advice is rip off DMC and Dynasty Warriors a bit more maybe.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow.
For an Early Access, this game is amazing!
Beautiful graphics, simple controls, great replayability and super fun gameplay!

The graphics are really, really nice. Probably better than the show's.
The controls are easy to understand and work very well.
The replayability is great.  I come back to this game everyday thanks to the different styles of gameplay.
And the gameplay...
Grimm to destroy, four different characters to choose from with four different special abilities to unlock, different passives for each character, and the satisfaction you get from defeating a large wave of Grimm...

This game is wonderful. And it's still an Early Access!

Here's a list of things I would like to to see in future updates:

-Character Customization. It would be really cool if the more you played, you could unlock different outfits from the show to put on your character

-Trading Cards. I need my Yang background. Now.

-Team JNPR. Yeah, this is obvious. Rooster Teeth are most likely to do this in the future.

-Improved Minimap. Instead of your allies being blue, it should be that you can see the faces of the character they're playing, and to see where a fallen ally is also.

-Ability Loadout. I'd love to customize which abilities I can unlock instead of staying with the same ones.

-More Character Voices and Lines. If we can get more lines from team RWBY (and possibly JNPR), it would be wonderful.

Thanks for reading!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: New Review for 12/19/2015 @ 2:29 PM EST


The Game may still be a very early access version of a much greater dream but I highly reccomend it still for those who are fans of the show or new arrivals to Rooster Teeth. (Not much new has occurred except for new visuals and info from the dev team during the livestream. Review has not changed)

[PROS/CONS]
+Beautiful graphical design. very similar to the actual show's design which adds to the immersion
+Voice acting, while limited, is high quality. The girls, Ryan, and Joel all did fantastic work
+Diversity. Yes there may only be four levels and an equal number of Grimm types but let's remeber where the roots of this game were with one level and one type of enemy based on the older concept of the Beowolf.
+Online connectivity. practically seemless ability to connect to matches and lobbies and no lag if a player drops mid game

-limited worlds/levels. As stated before, there are only four levels and those four levels are also highly restricted to a linear path. Hopefully the Game Dev team at Rooster Teeth will expand upon the limits of the levels they have (Can be forgiven thanks to the announced forever fall map in early 2016)
-Skill menu is too small. The choices in what to spend your skill points are still in the early stages so there aren't many things to put your points towards as many are locked away behind challenges
-Combat needs to be worked on. This goes as the most urgent of gameplay updates to me. there is only a dodge, no blocking and enemies gain both invincibility and speed during attacks making it tough to counter if at all. The addition of Lock on is also a must as ranged attacks are a real crapshoot for if you're gonna hit
-Only four characters. Yes I know, Team RWBY is the lead group but I would love to see the ability to play as JNPR, CFVY or even non Beacon affilitated teams like SSSN.
-More grimm are needed. Bring on swarms of Nevermores or giant Deathstalkers
-No boss fights. I want the Defend the control point" system to include a major boss at the end of each wave defense segment (4 waves of normal enemies/pack leaders and then one fight against a Giant Grimm or equivilant boss)
-Difficulty based lobbies. As of right now
date: difficulty adjusts to player count. i would love to see specific chosen difficulty (from easy or trainee
recommended:
to Very hard or True Huntsman or something)

[RECENT CHANGES]
Two patches have come out since My review of the game. These mostly adress preformance issues and don't work towards the combat system or the skill menus of the characters but they do make the game feel a bit smoother. Which is always an added bonus. There are also more breakable objects to find xp orbs in and while I didn't ask for it I'll welcome it all the same.

[WHAT I WOULD WANT UPDATED IMMEDIATELY]
First off
hoursPlayed: Fix the ranged attacks
voteText: if nothing else. Blake's ranged attack is too quick and overpowered. Ruby can only do three shot bursts and count your lucky stars for hitting something all three shots in a row (Saving grace is her personal armor piercing upgrade which allows you to damage the tougher enemies like Borbatusks and Ursa). Yang fires shots with a cone shape animated blast but from what I've seen the bullets still fire in straight lines. Weiss' attack is too slow compared to everyone else in the ranged catagory.\n\nSecondly
helpfulPercent: Lock on would be a godsend especially for challenge related skill use since it is very easy to miss an attack or do a combo straight out of the field of enemies.\n\nThird. Larger level scale
votesHelpful: the number of invisible walls are too damn high!\n\nStill
votesTotal: after a week and only two patches the game in my opinion is worth the time and money
votesFunny: now if you excuse me
commentsCount: I have challenges to complete and skills to unlock. Happy hunting

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start with a review for this.
First off, I love this game, for an early access title, it plays good. However, there's no reason to be biased, let me list the pros and cons to this game.

Pros:
-Dynasty Warriors and Left 4 Dead Co-op gameplay
-Characters have good personalities from the start, and the voice acting is great
-The game seems to have a great way of server connection, with my internet being bad 90% of the time, I never have problems connecting to another player's game
-Each character has their own skill trees, attacks, combos, etc.
-The Ultra setting looks amazing, I recommend building a PC for it
Cons:
-While it is Early Access, the animations are a bit choppy/delayed
-Doubles. By this, I mean that everyone can play as the same character (example: Four Weiss, Ruby, Yang, and Blake) leaving out so much variation at some parts of the game, making it not as fun when someone is playing as a double character.
-No voice chat, while this is a minor problem, it'd be easier to use voice chat instead of typing so you can easily communicate in the middle of battling
-No character saving, making it a bit tedious at times to play the same mission over again and starting back at level one
-Unless you're a RWBY fan, you won't understand much of the game

Now, here's some recommendations I'd like to see as the game updates and gets more larger:
-More characters or teams. It would be cool to be able to play as teams like JNPR or CFVY and be able to play as the characters from said teams
-Fix the Idle and Running animations
-Make character restrictions, so there's more variation in matches

Other than that, it's a great game with solid combat, great voice acting, and interesting story, I personally give it a 9/10
If you want to support RoosterTeeth, I recommend picking up the game while it's in early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW ALMOST EVERYTHING IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE*
As a fan of RWBY, when I saw this I Cried tears of joy, I scrownged up 15 dollars and got to playing.
Honestly for a Product, it dosen't come with much as of right now, only three levels and four characters, but what it lacks in quantity, it shines in quality. The gameplay acts as a Co-op Hack and slash type, which in my opinion is a really enjoyable experience. Most of the Characters have the Original Voice cast, but strangely Blake sounds a bit different for some odd reason, perhaps its how the game is directed or a different Voice-Actor all together, But thats a small detail.
Each Character has a different Skill Tree, and most of those skills are unlocked through Challanges, in which is actually a good Idea believe it or not, It encourages a different way of playing everytime. The Skills are the same set always and they don't sinergize with the combos very well, but again this is Early Access, so theres alot of room for Improvment.

Pros
-A RWBY Game Yeah!!!
-Gameplay is Enjoyable and not tedious [Looking at you Dynasty Warriors]
-All of Team RWBY is present
-The Level Design is pleasing
-Promising game
-Music is on point

Cons [Honestly these are more as Nitpicks at best.]
-Walking animation is a bit wonky with a few Characters
-Needs more Customization with Combos
-Voice-actors are a bit lacking

Overall as this game is now, Id give this game a solid
7/10 As of Day 1 this game is amazing, Hoping for some updates and more levels!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Time for this King to review this gem, known as RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
RWBY is a franchise that has become increasingly popular, and on top of the added pressure of finishing the production and distrubution of Volume 3 of the animated series after the creator, Monty Oum, rest his soul, passed away they have also begun putting time and effort into this gem of a game. With the ever-increasing fanbase RWBY has Rooster Teeth have some high expectations to reach for many people who are part of this fanbase including myself. Usually I personally don't touch Early Access games but this has been an exception especially after it broke several records in the Steam greenlight section and I have come out pleasantly surprised. Here are some things I have found about the game so far;

The good....Multiplayer Functionality - Now this is something I will admit I was genuinely surprised with. RWBY: Grimm Eclipse has an incredible amount of work put into multiplayer functionality, matchmaking systems and so on to the point I have experienced no problems with it, nor have any of my other friends who play this game. This is an amazing feat for a complete work let alone something in Early Access so I applaud Rooster Teeth for creating such a smooth multiplayer experience.
Adaptive Difficulties - I was concerned going into this game, having seen a screenshot of the options menu that it would be one-difficulty-suits-all". During gameplay I had several people leave the party and new members re-join and each time someone left or joined the difficulty had adapted to a level that was beneficial for all players

RWBY: Grimm Eclipse however does appear to have a good in-depth story behind it. Being Early Access only a very small amount is known about the story but what there is

As you advance in levels you gain ability points and spend ability points on what skills are available or to upgrade existing skills. reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDecent game but very unbalanced.  As the description said, it's a co-op hack'n'slash and I think therein is its problem: the repetitive predictability of hacking and slashing.  It reminds me of Dynasty Warriors (although minion enemies are way more active/aggressive) where the gameplay emphasis is overwhelmingly on button-mashing melee with the occasional spice of abilities thrown in.  In fact, the (only?) fastest way to recharge your resource to activate those abilities is to score sequential basic weapon hits without taking a hit in return.  In no way does this game feel like the spirit of the online show RWBY.  In the show, teammates constantly display new and inventive tactics where cooperative synergy is the dominant force and the finishing moves are mind-blowing uber powerful one-off abilities.  In Grimm Eclipse, however, the abilities play a minor role versus the efficacy of basic melee, are embarrassingly underpowered compared to the real" characters' inventive potency

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start with a review for this.
First off, I love this game, for an early access title, it plays good. However, there's no reason to be biased, let me list the pros and cons to this game.

Pros:
-Dynasty Warriors and Left 4 Dead Co-op gameplay
-Characters have good personalities from the start, and the voice acting is great
-The game seems to have a great way of server connection, with my internet being bad 90% of the time, I never have problems connecting to another player's game
-Each character has their own skill trees, attacks, combos, etc.
-The Ultra setting looks amazing, I recommend building a PC for it
Cons:
-While it is Early Access, the animations are a bit choppy/delayed
-Doubles. By this, I mean that everyone can play as the same character (example: Four Weiss, Ruby, Yang, and Blake) leaving out so much variation at some parts of the game, making it not as fun when someone is playing as a double character.
-No voice chat, while this is a minor problem, it'd be easier to use voice chat instead of typing so you can easily communicate in the middle of battling
-No character saving, making it a bit tedious at times to play the same mission over again and starting back at level one
-Unless you're a RWBY fan, you won't understand much of the game

Now, here's some recommendations I'd like to see as the game updates and gets more larger:
-More characters or teams. It would be cool to be able to play as teams like JNPR or CFVY and be able to play as the characters from said teams
-Fix the Idle and Running animations
-Make character restrictions, so there's more variation in matches

Other than that, it's a great game with solid combat, great voice acting, and interesting story, I personally give it a 9/10
If you want to support RoosterTeeth, I recommend picking up the game while it's in early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For me this game is worth the price tag for a couple of reasons, one is that I am a big fan of the RWBY series and Rooster Teeth in general and felt that offering $15 to help them progress in a field that they haven't really ventured into before is a small price to pay. Secondly, the game is actually very fun to play for a while. It's not Skyrim. I doubt you'll see anyone putting thousands of hours into this game, but for a couple hours of play its very worth it. And that was just my solo experiece, I'm sure it would be a bit more fun with friends to play with.

Now of course the game has its problems. It is a very early access game with a lot of potential for improvement.
The main issues are the sound design with a few issues regarding the movement animations. But for the most part the game looks pretty good and plays well. I do think that the number of enemies needs to be increased a bit or for a difficulty option to be added since the fights get a bit repetitive and predictable. Hopefully with some feedback and time though there can be features added to this game to make it just that much better.

Tl;DR: Fun game for a decent price with a few issues that will be improved upon with time but do not detract from the experience.

Minor issues aside this game is off to a wonderful start and I cant wait to see what more comes from this.
